events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra.
Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods.
You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control.
Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat.
The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years.
The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025.
First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’.
Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’.

events.id: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists.
In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list.
At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO.
Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works.
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO.

events.id: Circa Theatre 2025 Season-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Circa Theatre 2025 Season
events.venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces.
Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year.
Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented.
It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime.
Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind mirroring the water in the harbour.

events.id: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB) pushes boundaries with its 2025 programme.
Diverse and captivating works reflect the vision and influence of artistic director Ty King-Wall.

events.id: Wairarapa Festival of Christmas--Wellington NZ
events.name: Wairarapa Festival of Christmas
events.description:
Greytown is getting ready for one of the country’s happiest mid-winter celebrations.
The Wairarapa Festival of Christmas is an extravaganza blending northern hemisphere charm with Kiwi flair.
The month of festivities includes lights, laughter, and fun for all ages.
This year’s theme, ‘Christmas Carnival’, applies to events including a Light Up Tractor Parade, Illumination Night Walk, and Kids Circus School Programme.
There are also street parties, house tours, live music, and fireworks.

Make Hari boogie, bust a move, or challenge him to a dance-off.

events.id: Introduction to Restorative Practices-Tararua Tramping Club Clubrooms, 4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Introduction to Restorative Practices
events.venue: Tararua Tramping Club Clubrooms, 4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.description:
Join your trainers Sarah and Haley for a full day in person workshop to learn how restorative practices can foster collaboration, strengthen relationships, and effectively address conflict and harm.
This experiential training will equip you with practical tools to build a culture of trust, navigate difficult conversations, and promote accountability—without blame or escalation.
You'll gain immediately applicable strategies to improve communication, resolve tensions, and create a more connected and resilient workplace.
Format: In Person, in Wellington, NZ Location: Tararua Tramping Club Who Should Attend: All welcome Cost: NZ$695/person (gst included), includes catering and workbook Scholarships may be available - just ask.

events.description:
English in the Community: Johnsonville - Beginners+ (ESOL Level 1-2) English in the Community courses help you to learn more English, get to know your community and meet new people.
The groups aim to help you use what you already know, learn more from your tutor and the other students and feel more at home in your local community.
To enrol in these courses, please contact the CEC office on 04 385 8919 or cec@whs.school.nz.
By the end of the course, you will: • Feel more confident speaking English in everyday situations • Be able to understand more English • Have learned new words and basic grammar • Know more about living in New Zealand and your local community The courses are free for NZ residents and citizens.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.
Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse.
Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.
Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.
------ Set Menu (Includes one of each item per person) Cheery Cherry Curator A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet Mint to Be Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together Madeleine Moment A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist Sweet William’s Dish Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan.

events.id: Writers on Mondays-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
The poems in Biggs Family Prize in Poetry winner Nafanua Purcell Kersel’s Black Sugarcane can sting and soothe, revealing a paradise despoiled by climate change and colonisation, and celebrating a people resilient in the face of it all.
Mikaela Nyman is from the autonomous, demilitarised Åland Islands in Finland.
Her first poetry collection in English, Anatomy of Sand, follows on from her climate fiction novel Sado.
These two urgent contemporary voices join Tamara Tulitua in a conversation about rising seas, political and personal poetry, the local and global.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, and is supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Italian Film Festival 2025-Regent 3 Cinemas, 230 Queen Street, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Italian Film Festival 2025
events.venue: Regent 3 Cinemas, 230 Queen Street, Masterton
events.description:
The Italian Film Festival NZ returns to Masterton’s Regent 3 Cinema, bringing two glorious weeks of passion, laughter, romance, and cinematic brilliance to the big screen from 14 to 27 July 2025.
Now celebrating its 10th spectacular year, the festival showcases the very best of contemporary and classic Italian cinema — from timeless masterpieces to exciting new voices.
Whether you're a seasoned Italophile or just in need of a winter escape, this is your ticket to La Dolce Vita.
Opening Night – Monday 14 July, 6.30pm Join us for GLORIA!, a bold and joyful story of rebellious young musicians reimagining classical music.
We wish to share with you a celebration of Italy's storytelling, passion, and rich cultural heritage.

events.name: WLG | Becksteiner Winzer Wine Tasting
events.venue: 172 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Exclusive Wine Tasting with Becksteiner Winzer An Evening of Fine Wines, Inspiring Stories, and New Opportunities Guests are invited to an exclusive wine tasting featuring a curated selection of premium wines from Becksteiner Winzer, one of Germany’s most respected and innovative wineries.
The evening will be highlighted by a special visit from Michael Braun, CEO of Becksteiner Winzer, who will present a handpicked range of their finest wines and share the inspiring story behind the brand’s heritage and vision.
This event offers a rare opportunity to experience exceptional German wines and to be amongst the firsts in New Zealand to consider offering Becksteiner’s outstanding range in retail, hospitality, or corporate settings.
Guests are kindly asked to indicate any dietary requirements upon registration.
A toast to exceptional wine and new possibilities.

events.id: Wellington Leadership Group: Leading from Within: Servant Leadership Through the Lens of PTSD Recovery-40 Mercer Street, City, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Leadership Group: Leading from Within: Servant Leadership Through the Lens of PTSD Recovery
events.venue: 40 Mercer Street, City, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Nick Tomlin’s talk, Leading from Within: Servant Leadership Through the Lens of PTSD Recovery, shares a powerful account of how living with PTSD has deepened his understanding and practice of Servant Leadership.
The session encourages leaders to embrace authenticity, support mental well-being, and foster cultures rooted in trust and service.
About Nick Tomlin Born in Kent, England in 1968, [Name] served 25 years across the British Army and Royal Air Force, rising from Combat Medical Technician to Special Forces Commander of the Light Surgical Group.
His deployments took him from Northern Ireland to Afghanistan, and he also proudly represented his service in rugby, cricket, and Ironman events.
Following retirement, he became Medical Manager for the London 2012 Olympics before emigrating with his family to New Zealand.

events.id: Beyond the Frontlines: an award-winning documentary about Palestinian humanity-65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Beyond the Frontlines: an award-winning documentary about Palestinian humanity
events.venue: 65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Justice for Palestine and Aotearoa Healthcare Workers for Palestine present Alexandra Dols' award-winning documentary about the impacts of dehumanising violence on Palestinian people.
In an environment where language of 'objectivity' and 'neutrality' is used to prop up colonial structures, we are proud to screen a documentary that refuses to buy into this framing.
Embark on a journey across Palestine alongside Palestinian psychiatrist Dr. Samah Jabr and discover the resistance and resilience of a people affected by the invisible wounds of war and occupation.
Check out the trailer here.
Net revenue from tickets and donations will be donated to the Gaza Mental Health Foundation: https://www.gazamentalhealth.org/ Arrive from 5.30pm for a 6pm start.

events.id: Expressive Watercolour - 8 Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Expressive Watercolour - 8 Week Course
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results.
The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.
In this course we will learn to set the conditions for surprising and beautiful accidents to occur on the page.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different ways they can be combined to find a personal style.

events.id: Dark Sky Business Capability Course – Wairarapa Edition-Masterton District Council, 64 Chapel St, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Dark Sky Business Capability Course – Wairarapa Edition
events.venue: Masterton District Council, 64 Chapel St, Masterton
events.description:
Learn how to build a science-based, unforgettable stargazing experience for your business.
Join the Dark Sky Business Capabilities course!
We want people to come to our region again and again to take in the night sky and learn how to look after it.
There is space for everyone in this business, but it takes more than just pointing a laser at the stars to navigate the night sky.
In this course, you’ll learn how to: - Integrate stargazing into your existing business - Design unforgettable dark sky experiences - Use storytelling and science to engage your visitors - Navigate dark sky regulations, gear, and location logistics This is a practical, hands-on workshop designed for tourism operators, educators, accommodation providers, and anyone interested in astro-tourism.

events.id: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to FLIGHT and SÉANCE?
Book your first experience and then wait to receive your confirmation email to access your unique discount code to book your second experience at a discounted rate.
FLIGHT is an unsettling journey in complete darkness, using DARKFIELD signature 360 degree sound design inside a custom-built shipping container.
The many worlds interpretation of Quantum Mechanics proposes all possible outcomes that could occur, are occurring in countless worlds of varying similarity.
Find comfort in knowing that however ill advised your life choices have been - there is a version of you who made better ones and is suffering less regret and embarrassment.

events.id: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to SÉANCE and FLIGHT?
A twist on a traditional séance relying on psychology and inclination towards superstition to alter your perception of reality.
Step inside, take a seat but don’t get comfortable.
Transforming a shipping container into a Victorian séance room, SÉANCE makes audiences question not just their beliefs, but also their own senses.
SÉANCE explores the psychology of a group of people who have been bombarded with suggestible material, and asks that they believe in what might be conjured up into the room with them.

events.description:
Learn how to make the transition from buddy to boss and lead a successful team.
As John F. Kennedy once said, “leadership and learning are indispensable to each other”.
Our Leadership & Management courses are designed to help you get the best performance from yourself and your team, providing you with the skills and techniques to become better than you ever perceived you could be.
The Leadership & Management Part 2 workshop will equip leaders and managers with the skills to build high performing and highly motivated teams; the skills to communicate effectively as a leader, become more self-aware, provide coaching and mentoring, deal with conflict in a constructive and productive manner along with developing ways to solve problems as a team.
This workshop also gives participants an understanding of the key concepts of leadership and leadership styles along with how to choose and implement a leadership style that is authentic and beneficial to both the organisation and the teams they serve.

events.name: Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings Expanding on our classic Lost Wax Cast Rings class,  in this course you get the opportunity to learn and experiment even further by adding precious gemstones to the cast jewellery making process!
All materials are supplied in your booking so you won't end up with surprise costs.
Included in your course: Use of a range of jewellery wax types to create 2 practice rings then 1  main project ring 5 facet-cut precious gemstones to set across your 3 rings (choose from rubies, spinels and sapphires in a range of colours) Industry standard casting services that we will send your wax models away to so they can be transformed into brass, bronze and sterling silver rings 2 original practice rings cast in bronze or brass 1 main project ring cast in Sterling Silver During sessions 1-3 you will be guided to sculpt a range of wax ring models and embed precious gemstones, finishing one ring each session ready for casting.
Casdt jewellery techniques and fabrication jewellery techniques can also be combined to great effect, which makes this course a fantastic option for beginners and experienced makers alike.
By the end of the course you will be able to: Evolve your jewellery making abilities with new and exciting klost-wax methods Design and create original sculptural ring designs Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting Sculpt soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting Form soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting Set faceted gemstones in wax for ‘cast-in-place’ setting methods File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Passchendaele: "Mighty few of the bearers are left"-1 Molesworth Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Passchendaele: "Mighty few of the bearers are left"
events.venue: 1 Molesworth Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Passchendaele - a word that conjures up the horrors of all wars, especially for those now intimately connected with what was then a small and innocuous village in Flanders, the Flemish region of Belgium.
In terms of casualties, the morning of 12 October 1917 was - and is - the worst and bleakest day in New Zealand’s history of warfare.
846 of our young men were killed on that morning alone and, by the end of the day, 2740 were dead, wounded or missing.
To commemorate those who fought and died, our Society Board invites you to join us and other guests as we remember the 1917 battle at Passchendaele.
The function will be hosted at Parliament Buildings by Cameron Brewer MP, Member for Upper Harbour and also a member of the Society.

Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: The Inner Magnet – Manifesting from the Inside Out Why do some desires seem to flow effortlessly into our lives, while others feel blocked at every turn?
What if the key to manifestation isn’t about effort, but alignment?
This workshop explores how the wisdom of yoga philosophy can help us shift from the noise of a reactive, conditioned mind into a space of deeper inner alignment.
Beyond just rewiring thoughts, yoga offers a map back to the part of us that is steady, clear, and deeply connected — an inner magnet that draws what is truly nourishing for our growth and transformation.
Through reflection, and an informed practice, you’ll be invited to consider how tuning inwards can begin to shape your outer reality in more meaningful ways.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Talk Toitoi To Me-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Talk Toitoi To Me
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.description:
They may be little fish in a big pond, but their growing impact has been sending ripples across Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne.
Toitoi, or common bully, have been translocated across three years from Kohangapiripiri near the Pencarrow Lighthouse to the Roto Māhanga/Upper Reservoir in Zealandia.
An endearing little ika, these fish are now thriving at Zealandia, being spotted along Te Māhanga stream, in Roto Kawau/Lower Reservoir, and downstream beyond the fence!
Central to the kaupapa of this project was ongoing improvements to translocating the fish as we worked with mana whenua to incorporate traditional mātauranga Māori methods, and now together we want to share the whole story with you.
Join us for our next Conservation Kōrero, where a panel of participants in the toitoi translocations from 2023-2025 share the development of the translocations and the discoveries we made along the way.

events.name: Mindfulness Meditation
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Mindfulness Meditation Meditation can help us with life’s challenges and is a wise way to work with strong emotions and stress, as well as enlivening the ordinary times.
It’s simple and doesn’t need any special resources.
Often learning to meditate is presented as something esoteric and mysterious but really it should be a straightforward thing based on our everyday experience.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Describe some ways in which modern psychology and ancient wisdom support meditation Understand what you need to do to make time for meditation in your life Describe practical tips to make meditation fruitful Practise different kinds of guided and silent meditation Find resources (books, on-line information, other classes and retreats) to support your meditation Bring a notepad and pen.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.description:
In this course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids.
These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.
In this course you will learn the following: - Focus on geometric shapes and solids and how they contribute to both realist and abstract drawing - Form an appreciation of geometry and shapes that can help with constructing a drawing - The important tools, methods and concepts of one-point, two-point and three-point perspective - Universal boxing, drawing ellipses - Hints in locating helpful lines and axis to draw real subjects - Introductory methods of working that blend perspective knowledge with real drawing situations All basic materials supplied.

events.name: Qi Gong
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Qi gong, pronounced “chi gong,” was developed in China thousands of years ago as part of traditional Chinese medicine.
Qigong has both psychological and physical components and involves the regulation of the mind, breath, and body’s movement and posture.
In most forms of qigong: Breath is slow, long, and deep.
Breath patterns may switch from abdominal breathing to breathing combined with speech sounds.
Dynamic (active) qigong techniques primarily focus on body movements, especially movements of the whole body or arms and legs.

The New Zealand Symphony Orchestra has joined forces with the Signature Choir to display traditional and contemporary music from the islands.

events.name: The Pipeline of Potential: A welfare-to-work policy report
events.venue: 157 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The Institute for Democratic and Economic Analysis (IDEA) invites you to attend the launch of its first research project: a deep dive into welfare-to-work policy at a light breakfast event on Thursday 24th July.
The Pipeline of Potential report looks at how we could transform the support we offer to unemployed people seeking paid work, simultaneously lifting their prospects and boosting the wider economy.
Join us to hear IDEA research director Max Rashbrooke opening up new perspectives on a long neglected policy area.
His recommendations outline investments in training and work programmes that could change lives and constitute a key building block for a more robust economy.
Please RSVP for this free event by clicking on "Get tickets".

The website has helpful information for: ·       people making choices and decisions (decision-makers) ·       family, whānau, and friends who want to support people ·       paid supporters working for disabled people or older persons with reduced capacity ·       supporters who have may hold legal roles such as EPOA (Enduring Power of Attorney), Welfare Guardian or Property Manager ·       advocates (people who speak up for others).

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Always wanted to try being a DJ but not sure where to begin?
Experienced and professional DJ Shan (Shannon Chng-Rawiri) will teach you all about the technical aspects, equipment and terminology, as well as the industry in general, and enable you to put together a confident short performance.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Gain an understanding of the work content and career opportunities in this industry - Learn the difference between what a DJ is required to deliver in the following situations: Mobile, Club, Radio, Turntablist and Hobby - Participate in various practical activities: Slip Cueing and Baby Scratch, basic beat matching and song structures Gain a good understanding of the equipment used and terminology including: Tables: pitch control Mixer: crossfader, input faders, EQ, gain, cue system Needles: back tracking Slip Mats Learn about Counting Bars and Matching Tempos - The difference between a Bar, Phrases and BPM - Techniques to Count, Hand position and movement etc - Confidently present a 5 minute performance in class The course will be held at DJ Shan’s studio at Shop 21, 71 Cuba Street, Wellington.
Limited to eight participants.. Bring headphones, a USB with your favourite music and a laptop, if you have one.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington
events.description:
Come along to our free Japanese Film night, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!
Synopsis Discover Kiki’s Delivery Service, a fantastic coming-of-age tale full of magic, adventure, and self-discovery from the sensational imagination of Academy Award–winning director Hayao Miyazaki (2002, Best Animated Feature, Spirited Away).
Kiki is an enterprising young girl who must follow tradition to become a full-fledged witch.
Venturing out with only her chatty black cat, Jiji, Kiki flies off for the adventure of a lifetime.
Landing in a far-off city, she sets up a high-flying delivery service and begins a wonderful experience of independence and responsibility as she finds her place in the world.

events.id: Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings The lost wax process offers a wide range of creative outcomes such as 3D forms and textures, which are not achievable with fabrication soldering techniques.
Included in your course: Explore using a range of jewellery wax types to create 2 practice rings and 1 X main project ring Access to industry-standard casting services where we will send your  wax models to be transformed into brass, bronze and sterling silver rings 2 original practice rings cast in bronze or yellow brass 1 main project ring cast in sterling silver In sessions 1, 2 and 3 you will be guided to sculpt a range of wax ring models, finishing one each session so it is ready for casting.
These first 2 rings are a great opportunity to practice techniques and experiment with shapes, textures and designs before making your main project ring which will be cast in sterling silver!
This course offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience, it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels!
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -          Evolve your jewellery making abilities with new and exciting lost wax methods -          Develop and create unique sculptural ring designs -          Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting -          Form soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting -          Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting -          File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.description:
Deva Mahal is stoked to present her new album Future Classic live to Aotearoa audiences for the first time.
Born with the blues in her blood, Deva Mahal blends powerhouse vocals, soul-drenched songwriting, and genre-crossing artistry into a sound uniquely her own.
Raised in Hawai’i and musically rooted in New Zealand, she emerged in New York with her debut album RUN DEEP (2018), and has since built an international career spanning sold-out tours, major festivals, and film appearances.
She has graced legendary stages from the Hollywood Bowl and Carnegie Hall to Bonnaroo and the Montreal Jazz Festival, appeared in David O. Russell’s American Hustle, and contributed to the soundtrack of The Experimenter.
A three-time APRA Silver Scroll finalist and A2IM Indie Award nominee, and performed at the 2021 Biden-Harris Inauguration.

This is the perfect place for absolute beginners to get acquainted with the joy and art of improvisation, inspired by the generous creative philosophy of Keith Johnstone.

events.id: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 1-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 1
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
Anthony Donaldson is one of this country's great drummers a pioneer of improvised music in Aotearoa.
A visual artist before becoming a musician, Anthony's starting point on the drums was in finding tonal colours, rhythms that come from nature, and constructing a drum kit that grew like a living sculpture, Beginning in the late 70s and early 80s with Primitive Art Group, his music making has always centred on free improvisation and collective composition.
His musical journey has seen him perform with countless ensembles, often of his own creation, including the Black Sheep, Six Volts, Razorblades, Mean Bones, Flower Orphans, Teeth, Devils Gate Outfit, Rubbernecks, Farewell Spit, Melancholy Babes and the Stinging Nettles.
He has been a creative force in Wellington music for over four decades and continues to push the boundaries of accepted musical norms, while encouraging and mentoring younger players.
For the first of his two night performance residency Anthony will be performing solo and in collaboration with: trio with Nell Thomas (electronics) / David Long (guitar) trio with David Donaldson (bass banjo) / Steve Roche (brass) trio with Jonny Marks (Synthi AKS) / Daniel Beban (reel-to-reel) Listen here to a recent Dancing in Your Head podcast featuring Anthony playing some of his own music and tracks which he's been listening to.

events.id: Lung Cancers in Palliative Care Workshop-331 Suffolk Road Nelson, Nelson 7011-Event Brite
events.name: Lung Cancers in Palliative Care Workshop
events.venue: 331 Suffolk Road Nelson, Nelson 7011
events.description:
In New Zealand, lung cancer causes more deaths than any other cancer, more than breast, prostate and melanoma combined.
More than 1800 New Zealanders die from lung cancer each year.
The reason that lung cancer has such a high mortality is that 74% of the patients present with advanced lung cancer on initial diagnosis (Cancer Research Trust , NZ).
Symptoms of lung cancer are varied and supporting people with advanced disease requires a holistic approach.
Target audience: Health Care Professionals in all settings Limited attendees: Registration is essential For further information contact the Nelson Tasman Hospice Education Team:

events.id: Anyone Can Draw - Structural - Mornings-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Anyone Can Draw - Structural - Mornings
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
In this 8 week morning course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids.
Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.
Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.
It can also help in your realist drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments.
These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

events.name: July Work Smarter Horowhenua. Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
events.venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
You’ll walk away with: A clear, practical understanding of how AI works and how to use it Proven tools tailored for small businesses Plug-and-play workflows to save time and reduce mental load Confidence to use AI without compromising your brand, your values, or your people.
No tech jargon.
I’ve come away with a whole lot more knowledge and food for thought than I was anticipating and feel empowered to start implementing AI tools from today.” About Lizi Guest (your workshop facilitator) I’m the founder of Little & Loud, an award-winning public relations and communications agency that’s worked with more than a hundred organisations; from local councils and government agencies to fast-growing businesses and national brands.

As the year reaches the half-way point, what better way to keep warm this winter and celebrate with friends and family than by booking a table at Tirohana's Mid-Winter Christmas themed nights (and days) to be held over lunch and dinner over two weekends (June 27-29 and July 25-27).
An annual tradition in Martinborough and the Wairarapa, Tirohana Cellars' Restaurant will be transformed into a magical Christmas winter wonderland, with twinkling fairy lights, mulled wine, Christmas trees, evocative music, the warmth of the open fire - and who knows, we might even get some snow in the vineyard!?
:) There is a festive menu where Christmas turkey and all the trimmings will be on offer (with options for vegetarians/special diets).
But there are plenty of other options on the menu available for those who do not want to indulge in Turkey and ham off the bone, plum pudding and other favourites.
Reservations are essential to secure a table for lunch or dinner.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.name: Karetao Wānanga
events.venue: 1 Fell Street Blenheim, Marlborough 7202
events.description:
We are honoured to welcome esteemed cultural practitioners James Webster, Hinemoa Jones, Rikki Solomon, Whetu Silver and Horomona Horo, who will share their immense mātauranga.
Karetao are an integral part of Māori culture, despite limited documentation.
This collaboration enriches the performance and expression of Māori culture, weaving together sound, music, spirit, and storytelling.This wānanga includes a special performance on Friday evening, followed by weekend workshops focused on the creation of karetao.
This event is open to all whānau and community members — from tamariki to kaumātua.
Registrations are essential Cost: $50 per person (all ages)

Great help for sleep disorders, anxieties and fears but also when we want to get rid of bad habits.

events.description:
A somatic dance journey Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for a cosy, new moon gathering of ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.
There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body do the talking.
Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to move as you feel—awakening warmth, inner truth, and expression.

events.id: French Film Screening - Petit Pays-78 Victoria Street Level 3 Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: French Film Screening - Petit Pays
events.venue: 78 Victoria Street Level 3 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
🎬 Join us for a screening of Petit Pays (Small Country: An African Childhood) – a powerful and deeply moving French drama that explores childhood, identity, and the impact of conflict through the eyes of a young boy growing up in Burundi in the early 1990s.
The plot 👉 Petit Pays tells the story of Gabriel, a 10-year-old boy living a carefree life in a quiet neighborhood of Bujumbura with his French father and Rwandan mother.
But as tensions rise in the region and civil war looms, Gabriel’s world begins to unravel, forcing him to confront the complexities of his heritage and the harsh realities of a fractured society.
The trailer 👉 youtube.com/watch?v=FZL-NLhmBsU Adapted from Gaël Faye’s acclaimed novel, Petit Pays is a poignant film, rich in storytelling and emotional depth.
This film is rated R16 - The film is only for viewers aged 16 and over (Violence, cruelty, offensive language & content that may disturb).

events.id: The Eastern-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: The Eastern
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.description:
The Eastern are a string band that roars like a punk band, that swings like a gospel band, that drinks like a country band, that works like a bar band, that hopes like folk singers, and sings love songs like union songs, and writes union songs like love songs, and wants to slow dance and stand on tables, all at the same time.
Four albums and well over 1000 shows deep The Eastern have played and toured with Fleetwood Mac, Steve Earle and Old Crow Medicine Show amongst others, ticking off miles, countries and new friends and fans wherever they get to roaming.
‘No Depression’ magazine noted they were “One of the best modern roots acts, from any country”.
Both Radio NZ and the NZ Herald described them as “National Treasures” and The Heralds Graham Reid called singer Adam McGrath “NZ’s toughest minded songwriter”.
NZ country legend Barry Saunders simply called them “The Truth.” Built around the songs of 2024 New Zealand Music Award’s folk artist of the year Adam McGrath and Banjo legend Jess Shanks, The Eastern continue to prove they are a band of brothers and sisters you can’t help but believe in.

The Blue Summer are a five-piece surrounding themselves with wisps of funk, post punk, alternative rock, and pop.

events.id: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 2-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Anthony Donaldson - Master Drummer - Night 2
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
Anthony Donaldson is one of this country's great drummers a pioneer of improvised music in Aotearoa.
A visual artist before becoming a musician, Anthony's starting point on the drums was in finding tonal colours, rhythms that come from nature, and constructing a drum kit that grew like a living sculpture, Beginning in the late 70s and early 80s with Primitive Art Group, his music making has always centred on free improvisation and collective composition.
His musical journey has seen him perform with countless ensembles, often of his own creation, including the Black Sheep, Six Volts, Razorblades, Mean Bones, Flower Orphans, Teeth, Devils Gate Outfit, Rubbernecks, Farewell Spit, Melancholy Babes and the Stinging Nettles.
He has been a creative force in Wellington music for over four decades and continues to push the boundaries of accepted musical norms, while encouraging and mentoring younger players.
Pyramid Club is very happy to host Anthony for two nights, performing solo and in collaboration with a large number of outstanding musicians.

events.id: Offline Aotearoa!-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Offline Aotearoa!
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This fun, one day session builds upon a simple thought experiment: Aotearoa wakes up one day disconnected from the Internet, and the rest of the world.
However, local infrastructure, from cell towers, to datacentres and fibre networks, remain unscathed.
What could (or couldn't) we do with what we have?
What of our current network and communications infrastructure, and all our most used sites and services, would function when we’re ‘cut off’ from the rest of civilisation?
Join us in a playful lab environment helping build the first ‘map’ of what our digital experience would look like if it was just us - from healthcare, to education, banking and the big socials.

events.id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Beginners-Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Beginners
events.venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō Together we weave the mat for future generations Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes).
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako - Access to tools and harakeke - Harakeke is provided for your first two classes and then the tikanga is that you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have a $20 ‘Please harvest for me’ option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
Important information - It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia - At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable - For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you - If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class - We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
Teina - General - $25 Teina - Concession - $15 Teina - Koha - $7 Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $50.00 Optional - ADD ON - Please harvest for me: $10 (10 rau only) after first two classes - 3 days notice required Note: Eventfinda fees apply Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting - We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust.

events.venue: 78 Victoria Street Level 3 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
Join us for a delightful pastry workshop and learn how to make a classic Gâteau Basque: a golden, buttery cake filled with creamy custard or cherry jam 🥧 Guided by French Pastry Chef Valentin, you’ll get hands-on with the baking and discover the secrets of this beloved dessert from the southwest of France.
While your cake bakes, take a cultural detour with a lively presentation on the Basque region - famous for its strong identity, stunning landscapes, and of course, incredible food.
No baking experience needed.

You’ll taste your creation, of course, and head home with the recipe and confidence to make it again (and again…).

events.id: Walking with Alpacas-Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Walking with Alpacas
events.venue: Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Cantharis Alpacas offer guided walks with alpacas in the hills above the Kapiti Coast, conveniently located just 45 kms North of Wellington and just North of the new motorway.
During this unique experience you can learn about these beautiful creatures, and you will have ample time to meet, get close, walk, enjoy a cuddle and hand feed the alpacas.
On the way up and at the top you can also catch the stunning views of the Kapiti Coast, Kapiti Island, the South Island (on clear days) and beyond.
Ensure you have your camera ready to take photos and “selfies” of you and the alpacas.

events.id: After Austen: Em- Willis Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: After Austen: Em
events.venue: Willis Street Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
We are so excited to welcome award-winning playwright Sam Brooks, to discuss his play Em, a queer retelling of Jane Austen’s masterwork Emma, turned around, flipped and set in our very own Queenstown.
Emmett Woodhouse, handsome, clever and rich, with a comfortable home and a gay disposition has lived nearly [redacted] years in the world with very little to distress or vex him.
Until now.
Attendees get an exclusive 10% discount at Unity Books Sam Brooks is an award-winning and prolific playwright and journalist, who is largely noted for his critically acclaimed LGBTQ+ work, including Riding in Cars with (Mostly Straight) Boys, Queen, and most recently This is My Story of Us, which was co-winner of the 2024 Adam New Zealand Play Award.
He has been shortlisted multiple years for the Adam New Zealand Play Award, and won the Dean Parker award in 2023.

events.id: Book Launch: Lofty – The Short Life of Lieutenant Frank Long DFC-Hedleys Bookshop, 150 Queen St, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Book Launch: Lofty – The Short Life of Lieutenant Frank Long DFC
events.venue: Hedleys Bookshop, 150 Queen St, Masterton
events.description:
Rick Long invites you to the launch of Lofty: The Short Life of Flight Lieutenant Frank Long DFC, the story of a wartime hero from Masterton, written by local historian, Neil Frances.
In December 1937, 21 year old Masterton man Frank Long joined the Royal Air Force and was flying Whitley Bombers over Nazi Germany shortly after.
For 18 months Frank took part in the RAF’s early bombing campaign against Germany – a time of trial and many errors as the British Empire fought with its back to the wall against an aggressive and triumphant foe.
The launch will include a short talk and be followed by a book signing with Rick Long and Neil Frances.
All are welcome at this free celebratory event, but please RSVP to Hedley’s Books, Masterton on sales@hedleysbooks.co.nz, 06 378 2875 or text 027 281 6421

Watch the performers dance past – or if you're feeling inspired, jump in behind them and get your groove on!

It's also your last chance to take advantage of festival deals and offers at our gorgeous boutique stores, and admire their stunning displays.

events.id: Gong Bath at The Lotus Centre 26.07.2025-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at The Lotus Centre 26.07.2025
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Nick is a musician and Mindful Somatic therapist based in Wellington and has been putting on gong baths throughout Wellington and more recently in Kapiti.
The session has been crafted musically, leaning on deep drones from Paiste gongs and other instruments that harmonize together in layers, rather than loud, crashing strikes of the gong.
Nick considers the nervous system throughout, giving you an experience of 'dropping' into deeper brainwave states through the form and gentle introduction.
The sound of the session is more like contemporary ambient music using acoustic instruments than traditional Eastern music, and positive feedback has included: feeling extremely relaxed, to having psychedelic imagery, to processing old memories.
You never know what might happen, so its about just being open to the experience.

events.id: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
His voice too isn’t quite what you’d expect.
More smooth, more pronounced, and more powerful than his rough exterior may evoke.
He’s mostly performed with award-winning indie-folk band Albi & The Wolves but has written songs in many different projects, including a collaboration with Mt Eden Dubstep that has amassed over one million streams, or his side project Sneakers which has a single with over 750,000 streams.
Whether it’s on the stage or off Chris is known for his work ethic and as he sets out on a new journey, quietly creating new solo music, he’s excited to see where that leads.
For this show, Chris will be joined by the accomplished musician Hannah Morrell on the violin and maybe even the banjo.

events.venue: Whirinaki Whare Taonga, 836 Fergusson Drive, Upper Hutt
events.description:
Upper Hutt Brass Band presents Last Night of the Proms — a spectacular evening that blends the beloved traditions of London’s Royal Albert Hall with a distinctive New Zealand flavour.
Joining the celebration are The Hutt Valley Singers, alongside a host of talented local artists and soloists.
Raise your voice and wave your flag as you revel in stirring favourites like Jerusalem, Land of Hope and Glory, Sea Songs, and rousing patriotic marches — timeless highlights that capture the true spirit of this grand musical tradition.

events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington

After years backing many artists on the keys, and performing with the country's top musicians and artists, he has earned his stripes on the bandstand and is now out to make his own mark on the musical landscape.
Inspired by modern soul revival, classic soul cannon, R&B, funk and indie sounds, LOUIS TM brings his unique style of soul from Aotearoa to the world.
Recently joining the cast of Aotearoa supergroup FLY MY PRETTIES with Barnaby Weir & Laughton Kora for their 7th live album project 'Elemental' he has also spent time in RIA HALL's live band opening for L.A.B.
and performing at WOMADelaide (AUS).
Marking his own debut releases with a limited run of 7" vinyl of the tracks Mercedes Car / Never Give Up On Your Love met with acclaim, and the release of his debut album 'Shelter for a Broken Soul' in 2024 - out now on 180 gram vinyl.

The Undercurrent presents The Oscar Lavën Quartet: The Music of Django Reinhardt!
Dynamic woodwind virtuoso Oscar Lavën joins forces with swing guitarist specialists Adrian Jensen & James Quick, and double bass raconteur Robert Henderson to present a homage to the unique music of guitarist Django Reinhardt and violinist Stephane Grapelli.
Together they will create hard-working interpretations of the infectious, foot-stomping, film noir music known in 1940s Paris as Hot Club, in the perfect venue for this music, the bohemian wonderland, The Undercurrent.

🌊 Pasifika Ball 2025 – Tides of Tomorrow 🌊 Hosted by the Victoria University Pasifika Student Council Step into an evening of elegance, culture, and celebration as we gather for the Pasifika Ball 2025, themed “Tides of Tomorrow.” This is more than just a ball — it's a moment to honour our shared journey as Pacific peoples, acknowledge our roots, and look ahead to the future we are shaping together.
📍 Venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington 📅 Date: Saturday, 26 July 2025 ⏰ Time: 7:30 pm – 11:00 pm 🎟️ Dress Code: Formal attire What to expect: ✨ Live cultural performance ✨ Music, dance, and celebration ✨ Buffet dinner and dessert ✨ Awards ✨ Photobooths and memories to last a lifetime With the rising tide comes new horizons — let’s come together to celebrate the resilience, beauty, and brilliance of our Pasifika students.

events.name: Interlopers
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Interlopers will stand out at Vogelmorn Upstairs on July 26th, but we're sure they'll fit right into this gorgeous venue's shagpile vibe.
Following a memorable city debut at the Undercurrent, the quartet return with their fully-formed set of acoustic indie pop songs and stories.
And tickets are priced like a bottle of bachelor wine!
Interlopers are based around the long-gestating songbook of Andrew Armitage and mellifluous cello and vocals of Sarah Laing, backed by the solid sync of Phil Peleton on bass and David Morgan on percussion.
Mr. Morgan described their drummer-less incarnation as 'The Front Lawn' meets 'Violent Femmes' so they had no choice but to let him join.

events.venue: Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.description:
Join Felicity of Homegrown Botanica for a wander around the edges of the Innermost Community gardens to learn about commonly found, wild, edible weeds.
Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants.
Learn their names & get to know them, along with folklore & stories from the past.
By the end of the workshop you will: - understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting - feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants - know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits - know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging - know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor - feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.
Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.

events.id: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne-Common Ground, Featherston, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne
events.venue: Common Ground, Featherston, Wellington
events.description:
vegetable.machine.animal - 'Guest' album release gig featuring vegetable.machine.animal indigogue browne vegetable.machine.animal A live conversation between plants, fungi, machines, and human musicians What would it sound like if we could interact musically with plants and fungi—if humans stopped to listen and respond?
vegetable.machine.animal is an interspecies improvisational trio exploring this question through a hybrid sonic language of biosignals, modular synthesis, and live drums.
Led by drummer Kieran Monaghan, the project transforms living data from plants and fungi into voltage, translated into sound via modular synthesizer.
Their debut album, GUEST, was recorded during the 2024 Sonic Artist Residency (Creative New Zealand / NZSM / Toi Pōneke) and emerged through open-ended, intuitive sessions.
Kieran Monaghan is a self-taught multi-instrumentalist, writer, recording artist and sound bogan based in Te Whanganui-A-Tara.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Making and Mending-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Making and Mending
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
A poet’s toolbox is filled with techniques to help them kick-start or rebuild a poem, but sometimes the tried and true tricks aren’t enough.
How can poets engage with other forms of art and artmaking to challenge and reinvent how poetry is written?
New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse talks with Cadence Chung (Mad Diva), Gregory Kan (Clay Eaters), Jiaqiao Liu (Dear Alter), and Nina Mingya Powles (In the Hollow of the Wave) about how their creative pursuits and interests outside poetry shape and inform their latest collections.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, and is supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
NZIIA Wellington Branch is delighted to welcome members and guests to an upcoming event "Building a More Resilient Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security" This event will bring together the Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand John Pearson, and the Chief Operating Officer of Octopus Energy NZ, Margaret Cooney for a fascinating event on how the UK approaches the nexus between climate change, security and economic growth.
Margaret Cooney will discuss her thoughts on clean energy transition, technology and security and talk about what Octopus Energy has done in the UK and their goals in New Zealand.
-Registrations are required to attend this event.
Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand John Pearson In the early 2000’s John was the first in the UK to publish on the climate security nexus and helped to inform the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) at the time.
Margaret is dedicated to using technology for more affordable and sustainable energy and fostering a competitive New Zealand energy market.

AI is transforming the way we work, lead, and grow - but what does it actually look like in practice?

events.description:
Join us for an immersive workshop  that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.

events.id: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”-80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”
events.venue: 80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
By Claire Bruell Design & Production by Mike Reganon "This is your history, these are your stories, my gift to you."
But more than a gift to her grandchildren, these books spell out the trauma Jews have faced over millennia and, through her resolute and gently probing of the Bruell and Briess family trees over four generations, she exemplifies the lives of so many.
Claire will describe aspects of the process of creating that content from age 32 through to today, and with Mike, will speak about some of the features of working together and the exquisite joy of laying it all out on paper.
She has been a Justice of the Peace for 30 years and the coordinator of an oral history project in Auckland for almost as long.
Her days are focused on family and community.

events.id: Herman’s Hermits-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Herman’s Hermits
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
English rock and pop group Herman’s Hermits formed in 1963.
Still going strong 62 years later, the band heads to Wellington’s St James Theatre in 2025.
Known for jaunty songs and often tongue-in-cheek vocal style, Herman’s Hermits had many transatlantic hits.
With catchy tunes like Mrs Brown, You Got a Lovely Daughter, Henry the VIII, No Milk Today, and There’s a Kind of Hush, you’ll have plenty to tap along to.
Herman’s Hermits was one of the ‘British Invasion’ bands that followed the success of The Beatles in the 1960s and 70s.

events.venue: Odlins Square, Taranaki Wharf 2 Taranaki Street, Waterfront, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Integrating Regenerative Thinking in Adaptation Join us for a morning discussion aimed at intertwining regenerative thinking with climate adaptation.
We will look beyond traditional approaches for addressing climate change including flooding, sea-level rise, urban heat and hydrological impacts.
Featuring compelling international case studies, including a hallmark of proactive climate adaptation planning, the Denmark’s iconic “cloudburst” stormwater management.
We will challenge attendees to adopt a systemic approach to overcoming climate challenges.
Be part of the conversation that aims to shape sustainable and resilient futures for our communities.

events.id: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
With local elections fast approaching this October 2025, what is being done to achieve a #GenderEqualNZ within our political systems?
In the 2022 local government elections, only 38% of candidates were women.
Despite this being an increase from previous years, significant structural and cultural barriers persist for women seeking to enter and remain in politics.
She'll be joined by a stellar line-up of women: Susan Freeman-Greene, Chief Executive of Local Government New Zealand Tory Whanau, Mayor of Wellington City Afnan Al-Rubayee, senior public servant and community leader Rebecca Matthews, Wellington City Councillor This year’s Annual Women’s Debate will focus on the experiences of women from across the political spectrum and the gendered obstacles they have faced in politics.
Furthermore, the debate will explore what is being done to address barriers to women’s political leadership, and how women representatives can empower a #GenderEqualNZ.

events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
As the Christchurch Earthquake and Cyclone Gabrielle have shown, in an environmental disaster, Internet infrastructure and mobile communications are unreliable at best.
This 2 hour session will introduce participants to the Meshtastic platform, a post-internet mesh network in broad use in Pōneke/Wellington.
Meshtastic allows for sending messages even in a total blackout, right from your phone.
The Lower North Island already enjoys a very populous and active Meshtastic mesh, with many members focused on preparedness.
Come and learn how you can help strengthen and grow the community!

events.id: Exhibition Opening: Finn McLachlan - These Islands Are Not Still-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Exhibition Opening: Finn McLachlan - These Islands Are Not Still
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
This exhibition will present images and video from the trip, taken from a variety of cameras - both digital and analogue, including a crude analogue video camera that was made especially and which will also be on display!
--- Artist statement: New Zealand's subantarctic islands aren't very well known, even among New Zealanders.
Often seen in the form of a still image, I aimed to observe and then prove that these islands aren't still; they are thriving, dynamic ecosystems.
The physical process of capturing digital video is to most people an entirely abstract process that creates a certain barrier or disconnect between the viewer and the subject.
The inner workings of this camera are simplified to the extreme.

Can’t work out why some plants thrive and others barely survive?
Ready to make exciting changes but no idea where to start and not much gardening background?
Time permitting, we will look at photos of your gardens as “personal case studies” to help you get the most from the course.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: •Identify the style of your dream garden and learn what plants will best achieve this and guarantee success • Identify and work with the site and climate conditions of your garden/outdoor areas to be developed; modify plant choices if necessary • Accurately draw your detailed planting design on paper and to scale.
This is available in a separate course.

events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.
This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle.
You'll discover why your brain fixates on worry, how to interrupt rumination before it spirals, and master simple techniques that create instant mental clarity.
Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.
Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!

events.id: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming.
Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together.

events.description:
Stop the clocks - you won’t want to miss this adventure through time!
Wellington-based Dungeons and Dragons podcast Last In Initiative is back, and this time not even the clock can contain us.
Mark it in your calendars, get the date right, and be at BATS for three timeless tales, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp across time, space, and most importantly, the 80’s.
Join our players as they spark a Fantasy French Revolution in 1789, rob a speeding train in 1886, and get minimum wage jobs at an arcade in 1982.
Each night brings new adventure, new challenges, and most importantly, a new decade.

events.id: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Parenting today delivers unprecedented challenges – are you wondering what went wrong and somehow ended up living with a child you don’t recognise as should be belonging to you?
They have few self-care skills and skills relating to others, can’t take personal responsibility and don’t know what is enough or what is “normal” for others – these children end up having a difficult time of it in life and you will too.
You’ll take away new insight and knowledge plus strategies that you can apply that very night to help your child to be a responsible, likeable and respectful person.
By the end of the session, you’ll be able to: - Reflect on the current context parents are faced with today - Find the relevant research - Practise the parenting tools and discuss the model - Know where to go to get support Aimed at parents, grandparents and caregivers of children of all ages.
Presented by Madeleine Taylor.

events.id: Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World This workshop will be a confronting one that will expose you to the risks that children face in this modern overindulgent world.
Many have become used to being the constant centre of attention and are unable to delay gratification and aren’t competent in everyday skills.
They have few self-care skills and skills relating to others, can’t take personal responsibility and don’t know what is enough or what is “normal” for others – these children end up having a difficult time of it in life and you will too.
You’ll take away new insight and knowledge plus strategies that you can apply that very night to help your child to be a responsible, likeable and respectful person.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

Audiences can expect a mix of original songs and covers as the bands compete for a range of great prizes.

events.id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
events.venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.
Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland.
He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others.
In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers.

events.description:
Tessa Frazer & Friends is a chamber music concert featuring classical saxophonist Tessa Frazer, joined by musicians from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, and beyond.
The programme highlights the versatility of the classical saxophone through a range of chamber works for trumpet, piano, violin, bass trombone, flute, and saxophone.
Curated by Tessa, the concert features some of her favourite repertoire and presents the saxophone in a fresh and dynamic context.
All proceeds will support Tessa’s upcoming move to the Netherlands, where she will begin a Master of Music at Codarts, Rotterdam, studying under renowned saxophonist Femke IJlstra.

events.name: Yoga Nidra
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance.
It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.
What to Expect: - A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors - A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided) - A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts - Complementary herbal tea before/after the session; - An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired - A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.
Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).
So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

events.description:

Salmonella Dub began writing with Whirimako Black after touring with the band on their Feel The Seasons Change live with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra summer shows of 2008.
Look For Gold is the bands new 4 track EP featuring Whirimako on all four tracks.
The title track Look For Gold - [I'm Coming Alive Low-Phi Rockers Dub] - ft. Whirimako Black is an unreleased dub track written during the bands For All Things Alive album sessions cross pollinating Whirimako’s Return to our Kowhai vocal with a stripped back dub of Andy’s Jam produced by Harry Bretherton.
The bands Salmonella Dub SoundSystem ft. Whirimako Black, the Mighty Asterix and Dub horns are out touring the bands new releases over May & June in preparation for the bands remastered digital back catalogue re-issue.

events.description:
DOMUS: the duo of Tarik Rahim (Spain) and Mo Aung (Australia) - guide a journey through live improvisational soundscapes incorporating field recordings, synth textures and ethereal vocals.
Their performances reflect a fusion of their diverse influences - from lofi psychedelic to abstract electronic beats, contemporary neofolk and a merging of their respective South American and Southeast Asian heritage.
While being accomplished artists in their own right with this project they blend their sounds into a unified, compelling and resonant experience.
--- Juniper May is the latest solo project of Pōneke artist Lora May.
Using an SP-404, she channels and transfigures samples of found sounds, synths and field recordings into melodic, distant and estranged pop songs.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Sewing - The Basics Learn the essential sewing skills you need to get you started in this one-day workshop.
You'll take away your own lined bag and lots of ideas and inspirations for further projects.
A list of materials to bring (approximate cost $50) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
By the end of the workshop, you'll have been introduced to basic sewing skills and you'll be able to: • Use sewing machine equipment and demonstrate basic sewing techniques (basic seams and finishes) • Cut out and construct a lined bag using techniques learned • Line a bag • Work on a pin cushion (if time allows) Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.name: Cheesemaking - Brie and Queso Fresco
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cheesemaking - Brie and Queso Fresco The ultimate class in practical cheese making!
Learn all you need to know to replicate making NZ style Brie and Queso Fresco at home.
You will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Brie.
A small break will be provided and you will have the opportunity to purchase equipment and cheesemaking ingredients after the workshop should you wish to replicate the experience at home.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Make Brie and Queso Fresco - Recall the best milk to use and where to source it from - Name and identify what equipment and ingredients you need to make Brie and Queso Fresco Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Get the Job: CV and Cover Letters-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Get the Job: CV and Cover Letters
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Identify your key skills and weave these into your CV and cover letter to land you your next job interview.
Whatever job you are going for, there are key characteristics that should not be missed in your CV and cover letter.
The focus of this course is to provide you with the same lens as a recruiter.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Recognise the features of an effective, well-crafted CV and cover letter and apply these to your own job applications; - Apply different approaches, styles and techniques while writing your CV and cover letter depending on the context and job; - Help others with their CV and cover letter writing (friends and whānau).
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives There is a widespread ‘lack of confidence’ epidemic among creatives, and if you have ever felt like your work is not good enough, hesitated to submit your art to competitions, or doubted your skills when applying for creative jobs, you are not alone!
Creatives often feel imposter syndrome most acutely.
This concise workshop is designed to help you uncover the roots of this inner voice of insecurity and provide you with effective tools to overcome it.
Through engaging activities and practical exercises, you will learn how to transform self-doubt into a source of strength, empowering you to confidently share your unique talents with the world.
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
