events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
You'll learn to differentiate different parts of the pelvic floor, and also how the pelvic floor functions in conjunction with breathing and spinal movements.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to: • Recognise the anatomy of the pelvic floor, where the muscles are and how they work • Coordinate the pelvic floor muscles with breathing, and with the spine, and recognise its role in overall good posture • Discover what habits you have which work against your pelvic floor muscles working well • Practise exercises designed to help you rehabilitate and strengthen your pelvic floor Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.
For women only.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two mornings, this is our most popular short workshop!
We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.
They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.
Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!
Students can spend their afternoon and evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day.

events.id: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum-101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum
events.venue: 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
'Have you ever wondered what all the fuss is about vellum?
Botanical artist, Lesley Alexander will share her knowledge of painting on vellum.
Used as a writing and painting surface since before the Middle Ages, Lesley loves the luminosity and glow that can be achieved working this traditional way.
You will learn: what vellum is how it is prepared it's uses now and in times past how to prepare the vellum with pumice powder and watercolour techniques to work on this very beautiful surface before spending the rest of the time painting a small colourful Pohutukawa leaf.
Ideally you will have some experience using watercolour but that is not essential.

You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we’ll take care of the firing process.

events.id: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025-150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025
events.venue: 150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
As the internet is increasingly taken over by sponsored posts and AI-generated content, Wikipedia remains steadfast as a source of verifiable, up-to-date information.
All are welcome – whether you’re a complete newbie or have experience editing – take this opportunity to develop your skills while contributing to the world's most comprehensive encyclopedia.
We'll provide all the training and resources you need to get started, and the native vegetation of Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush will provide the perfect location for collaborating with fellow nature enthusiasts to share our unique biodiversity with the world.
Whether you want to come along for just one day, or book in for both, we’re looking forward to having you join us.
You can also come by car and park in the main public car park on Wilton Road or along Churchill Drive.

events.id: Radio Cartography-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Radio Cartography
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This one day event will involve getting out and about around Wellington CBD in an attempt to map it for radio shadows (communication blindspots) within the Lower North Island Meshtastic network.
The outcome will be a map which identifies areas where we need to install nodes to give coverage across the CBD.
These could become mission-critical to reaching loved ones in the event of an earthquake or blackout event.
We will meet at Critical Signals, 115 Taranaki Street, then head out into the city, rain or shine.

events.id: Silk Aquatint Printmaking-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Silk Aquatint Printmaking
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Discover the silk aquatint, an accessible, non-toxic alternative print technique similar to collagraph printing whereby the texture of woven silk on the plate provides a ground to start building a design with varying tonal qualities.
The outcome can be wonderfully detailed and painterly.
In this workshop you will learn - - To identify appropriate silk to create an aquatint plate - The importance of preparing an appropriate matrix for the silk - About the different effects created by different types of media applied to the print matrix - To make an aquatint plate - To print an aquatint plate This workshop is open to beginners as well as seasoned printers.
Basic materials included.
Bring drawings or designs to help you get started and wear clothes you are not precious about.

events.id: NZ's Top Dog Film Festival 2025-Coco At The Roxy, 5 Park Rd, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: NZ's Top Dog Film Festival 2025
events.venue: Coco At The Roxy, 5 Park Rd, Wellington
events.description:
The beloved Top Dog Film Festival is back at the Roxy on Saturday 2 Aug, 12.30pm for another heartwarming season, with a brand-new line-up of short films that celebrate the extraordinary connection between dogs and humans.
Touring around NZ, the 2025 festival features tales of adventure, resilience, and canine joy — reminding us why dogs truly are our best friends.
This year’s curated collection brings together incredible real-life stories from around the world — from bloodhounds tracking poachers in Africa to ultra-running Vizslas in the Pacific Northwest, pampered hotel pups, and unlikely sporting heroes.
Whether it’s laughter, tears, or feel good moments you’re after, the 2025 Top Dog Film Festival delivers it all, one wagging tail at a time.

events.id: "Zentangle" Mindful Drawing Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: "Zentangle" Mindful Drawing Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
This is a fun and relaxing method that allows individuals to create beautiful images through structured patterns.
Ashwini, your tutor, is a Certified Zentangle Teacher (CZT) and provides an authentic learning experience backed by Zentangle Inc. Training directly from its creators, Maria Thomas and Rick Roberts.
In this workshop, you will learn - The Zentangle method - step-step guided drawing - Philosophy behind each step of Zentangle - focusing on midnfulness and relaxation - Gain insight on improving focus, motor skills and stress management - Next steps in Zentangle practice All materials included and for participants to take home with them: 3.5 inch white paper tiles artist quality pens pencils other supporting art supplies.

events.id: Troy Roberts Masterclass-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Troy Roberts Masterclass
events.venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
This afternoon is a rare opportunity to catch internationally renowned saxophonist, Troy Roberts presenting a masterclass on topics including improvisation, approaching standards, and a discussion of a life in jazz.
The New York City based Australian immigrant is a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name.
Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today.
Embracing his love for a vast variety of stylistic genres, the three-time GRAMMY nominated saxophonist is quickly becoming one of the most widely recorded touring artists of his time.
As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, to numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.

events.id: Avenoir- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Avenoir
events.venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Avenoir, a unique and innovative Dance Performance choreographed by Jenire, delves into the idea of what life would be like experienced backwards.
Is the unknown of one's life journey really a curse or is it a blessing?
It’s like driving through the fog, trying to see ahead.
Have those past rejoin your life again, look forward to your best days and prepare for your worst) Sage: Now beginning life with insight and awareness, you pass on this wisdom and guide those close.
Exuberant: The one that is left now returns to life, bringing back all innocence and purity to the joyfulness of early life.

events.id: Sacred Pulse - A Journey for Palestine Fundraiser-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sacred Pulse - A Journey for Palestine Fundraiser
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for an Ecstatic Dance and Sound Journey to raise vital funds for Mahmoud Al-Madhoun and his family, who are from Northern Gaza.
Unfortunately, Mahmoud and Omnia’s three big brothers were denied evacuation.
Mahmoud and Nour have lost everything, their house, their livelihoods, and have been forced to evacuate multiple times, all while managing the complexities that come with supporting a child with difficult medical needs.
Let’s come together in movement and music to support this family in their time of urgent need.
Her sound frequencies and crystal-clear presence invite you into a realm of deep remembering, restoration, and renewal through the power of sound.

Immerse yourself in the timeless classics and chart-topping hits that defined a generation, as our talented musicians faithfully recreate the magic and allure of Fleetwood Mac’s unforgettable sound.
From the haunting melodies of Stevie Nicks to the soulful rhythms of Lindsey Buckingham, “The Fleetwood Mac Experience” captures the essence of one of the greatest bands in rock history.
Join us for a night of nostalgia, as we pay homage to the legendary Fleetwood Mac and invite you to experience the passion, the drama, and the extraordinary music that continues to resonate with fans around the world.
Get ready to relive the magic – because with “The Fleetwood Mac Experience” the spirit of Fleetwood Mac lives on.

events.id: InDuna - Go High - EP Release- Riddiford Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: InDuna - Go High - EP Release
events.venue: Riddiford Street Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today.
It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience.
The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.Doors open: 9:00 PMShow starts: 9:30 PMVenue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, WellingtonMoon is a wheelchair-accessible venue with both seated and standing options available.When the NFC ticket bundle is purchased, fans will get exclusive access to a limited edition NFC-enabled EP, featuring the full EP plus unreleased demos and future tracks, delivered directly to your device before they’re available anywhere else.
InDuna merchandise will also be available on the night — don’t miss it.About InDuna:Self-taught artist and producer InDuna blends Afro-pop with the vibrant spirit of his South African heritage.
He was recently honoured with the Young Global Achiever Award at the 2024 Prince’s Trust Awards in London and recognised at Buckingham Palace by King Charles III.His music has reached global ears, with his track ‘Dreams’, written for the documentary Ink and Gold: An Artist’s Journey to Olympic Glory, winning Best Original Song at the International Online Web Fest and climbing to #6 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart.

events.id: Correct Colour Pencil Techniques for Botanical Drawing-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Correct Colour Pencil Techniques for Botanical Drawing
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Colour pencil is an exciting art form when practiced correctly, and works well with creating beautiful botanicals.
In this workshop Sandra will share the tips and tricks she has used in her botanical drawings.
You will learn: • How to capture the shape and form of your flower or leaf using basic shapes to start with.
• Working with the correct colour for undertone to create light and dark • How to achieve clean veins and /or fine hairs • How to achieve highlights • The most suitable tools for blending.
• Suitable for all skills level ages 15years+ Materials provided: colour pencils & paper Materials participants need to bring: - HB pencil - Tombow clutch eraser rounded or similar (example: https://www.gordonharris.co.nz/product/22770-tombow-mono-zero-eraser-pen-round?categoryId=1454) - Double ball stylus or similar (example: https://www.gordonharris.co.nz/product/2777-double-ball-stylus-1-2mm-2-8mm) Venue location: Akoranga Learning Pavilion in the Discovery Garden at Wellington Botanic Garden Google Maps: https://maps.app.goo.gl/PQdG7LCYSKEDYgKA8 Please note: This event requires a minimum of 8 bookings to go ahead.

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).
As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?
Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours!
How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.
Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee-Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee
events.venue: Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington
events.description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities.
We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery.
We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates.
A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.

events.description:

Your tutor Joanne will lead you through a series of drawing exercises with a live model, while you work on proportion, light and shadow, and capturing dynamic energy.
This is a great regular workshop to practice the basics, and develop your artistry and personal style in your drawing practice.
Come learn with a friendly crowd!
$40 pp bookings at registrations@farehamcreativespace.co.nz

events.id: Nature Journaling-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nature Journaling
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
A gentle ramble around parts of the botanic gardens with botanical artist Sandra Morris, using careful observation and journalling techniques to record how our personal connection with our environment changes our perception and wellbeing.
You will learn: • Different ways to observe and the practice of mindfulness and wellbeing • Different ways to record visually, eg.
diagrams, sketches, careful drawings, maps, graphs • Different ways to record in words, numbers • Approaches to page layout • Suitable for all skill levels- with a desire to learn to observe and connect with the natural world around you.
Materials participants need to bring: - sketch book A5 or A4 or photocopy paper with backing board with clip for attaching paper to board - drawing pencils and/or drawing pens - colour pencils or whatever you prefer to work with Please note: This event requires a minimum of 8 bookings to go ahead.
If fewer than 8 people register, the event will be cancelled and any fees paid will be fully refunded.

events.name: Pataka Friends Winter Music Series - Hobnail
events.venue: PATAKA Art + Museum, Cnr Parumoana and Norrie St, Porirua - Mana
events.description:

events.venue: Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae
events.description:
Programme Beethoven: Piano Trio, Opus 70, No 1 "The Ghost" Takemitsu: Between Tides Glen Downie: Sonata da chiesa Shostakovich: Piano Trio No 2, Opus 67 The Ghost Trio will perform in Waikanae as part of a Chamber Music New Zealand tour.
Popular New Zealand musicians Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and pianist Gabriela Glapska are all familiar faces on the Waikanae stage, having appeared with numerous other chamber ensembles.
Two brief and contrasting works complete the first half of this varied concert.
The second half of the concert will be dominated by one of the greatest piano trios of the 20th Century - Shostakovich's Opus 67.
It is an elegy for the tragic victims of war, but also expresses Shostakovich's grief at the sudden death of his closest friend and mentor Ivan Ivanovich Sollertinsky.

events.id: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This lecture, delivered by Julian Oliver, will introduce participants to the potentials and pitfalls of self-hosted server infrastructure, whether that be a PC-turned-server hosted at home, studio or office, or on a server rented at a datacenter.
Starting points for self-hosting will be covered, with an introduction to system administration in the context of digital caretaker, guardian and gardener.
The lecture will position self-hosting as an act of infrastructural resistance and reclamation in an era of pervasive digital imperialism and extractivism.
The talk will also assess free and open source platform alternatives to Big Tech, from cloud, to webmail, forum, team chat, and more.

events.id: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind Transform your relationship with anxiety in just 60 minutes using the revolutionary FasterEFT technique that's helping thousands worldwide break free from the grip of panic and overwhelm.
In "Peace over Panic - Rewiring the Anxious Mind," you'll discover how your mind creates anxiety through unconscious patterns and learn a simple yet powerful tapping method to literally rewire your nervous system for calm and confidence.
Unlike traditional therapy that can take months or years, FasterEFT works at the subconscious level where anxiety is actually created, allowing you to experience immediate relief and lasting change.
Whether you struggle with daily worry, panic attacks, or overwhelming stress, this workshop will give you practical tools to take control of your mental state and create the peaceful, confident life you deserve.
Leave with a complete system you can use anywhere, anytime to transform anxiety into inner peace.

events.description:
Local opera company Wellington Opera presents a grand production.

events.id: Weather Commoning: Chris Berthelsen-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Weather Commoning: Chris Berthelsen
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Critical Signals from the Japanese Government's Moonshot Goal 8 Project The Japanese government's Moonshot Goal 8 project aims to create a society safe from extreme winds and rains by controlling the weather by 2050.
The Weather Commons Research Group, led by Tsuyoshi Hatori (Ehime University), is developing and exploring 'weather commoning’.
This involves the exploration of symbiotic relationships with weather patterns and disasters, non-normative ethics based on local community practices, and citizen participation in technological development.
Please join weather commons group leader Tsuyoshi Hatori and member Chris Berthelsen (originally Tāmaki Makaurau) for an introduction to the state of weather control, calming, and commoning research and activity in Japan.
This is a space for open discussion, but you are also free to sit back and listen.

events.id: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno-33 Bunny Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: From Galileo to Laudato Si’: Why Science Needs Faith - Br. Guy Consolmagno
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
This event is also available online on Zoom.
How we understand faith and science has changed radically from the time of Galileo, as can be seen in how Pope Francis blended science and faith in his encyclical Laudato Si’.
Its key insight is that our science, and the technology it spawns, is deeply connected to the flawed but redeemable human persons who do the science, and who make and live with technology... and its consequences Br.
Guy Consolmagno, SJ, is an American Jesuit brother and planetary scientist, currently serving as the Director of the Vatican Observatory and President of the Vatican Observatory Foundation.
He is known for his research on meteorites, asteroids, and the evolution of small solar system bodies, as well as his popular writings on astronomy and faith.

events.id: Ka Mua, Ka Muri: an Introduction-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ka Mua, Ka Muri: an Introduction
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, we are proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of The Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
Therefore, we announce with great pleasure that noted historian Dame Claudia Orange DNZM OBE CRSNZ will present our opening lecture in this series, which focuses on the history of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the Waitangi Tribunal.
Encouraging discussion on the Treaty of Waitangi is a vital part of continuing efforts to fulfil the promise of the 1840 agreement.
Dame Claudia argues that a broad public understanding of the changes that have occurred in the Māori–Crown relationship is essential in order for those relationships to grow.
The exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of The Waitangi Tribunal will remain open to view until 8pm.

Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers.

Concert Two: Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Antipodes Quartet Artists onstage: NZSQ / Antipodes Quartet Shostakovich: 6th and 7th String Quartets, String Octet Unpacked: The music of Gao Ping Spotlight: Be part of Aotearoa’s musical history, as the first chapter of the newly formed Antipodes Quartet unfolds in their Wellington debut.

events.id: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature-175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
events.venue: 175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement.
This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you.
We speak of “getting into nature” as something we have to do — yet Earth-based traditions have always seen the plant and all beings as interconnected and sacred, humans as one with the Earth itself.
Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.

events.id: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
Many people believe they’re eating healthily, yet still experience fatigue, inflammation, and discomfort.
Why is that?
In this workshop, you’ll explore food as medicine and gain insight into how to eat in a way that restores vitality, supports digestion, and balances your energy naturally.
What you’ll learn – The energetic qualities of different foods – How to identify which foods suit your constitution best – The ideal times to eat during the day and why timing matters – How TCM views food as fuel for both physical health and life force Whether you're curious about Eastern approaches to wellness or looking for practical tools to support your health, this workshop will offer a fresh and meaningful perspective on your relationship with food.
Meet Jinfeng, your host As a scholarly well-being practitioner with a long history of family heritage (great grandfather and father), Dr. Jinfeng has been practicing Taoist Qigong and Buddhism Great Awakening Zen Meditation to sharpen her own sense and boost her own physical vitality.

events.id: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble-55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble
events.venue: 55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Photography – The Art of Paying Attention In this lecture Anne Noble will discuss modes of collaborative practice across a series of projects that spans her work with bees as well as current projects concerning the environmental degradation of our waterways.
In 2023 Anne Noble was commissioned by Ngāi Tahu to create an archive of images that would reveal the deteriorating state of freshwater across South Island waterways and the resulting impact on mahinga kai customs and practices.
He is remembered for his passion for the medium, support of photographers and their work and his special love of practices he termed lyric, transcendent or poetic documentary photography.
In association with the Peter Turner Lecture a fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to support the Peter Turner Scholarship that was launched in association with the lecture and each year provides a postgraduate student scholarship for a student engaging with social and cultural issues through the medium of photography in its broadest sense.
The Peter Turner Fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to grow the support this scholarship can offer young photographers aspiring for a career the lens based arts.

events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality.
Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.

events.description:
The Photonics is an optical sound project of Daniel Beban and Tim Barlow.
Taking a cue from early experiments in light and sound technology, various light emitting sources (including ultraviolet therapy torches, strobes, remote controls and regular LED and tungsten bulbs) are modulated into sound via solar panels, resulting in an immediate and direct transposition of the optical into the audible.
Sometimes dreamy, sometimes upbeat anti-capitalist anthems.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Manage your thoughts and critical voice under pressure -  Visualise and mentally rehearse for success -  Recognise your emotional reactions and manage your emotions under pressure -  Utilise techniques to manage anxiety -  Demonstrate interview skills and deliver well-formed responses to questions -  Understand the STAR model and other communication techniques and how and when to use them Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

What’s included in this workshop: - Demonstration of the steps to framing your work - assembling the tools you need - choosing and cleaning frames - how to size and cut an acid free mat - what sort of tapes to use for each task - various fixings for hanging and D-rings - replacing acid leaching materials with foam board - cutting techniques - making and attaching labels and swing tags - how to photograph your art Hands-on session where you will learn to cut card, cut a window in the matt board, present, secure, tape, screw in D-ring, tie knots etc All materials will be provided including knives, metal ruler, cutting board, crescent board for the mat, mat cutter, tape, d-ring, string.

Hori Shaw, Shane Walker and Te Wehi are arguably three of the most popular Kiwi artists in music right now, with all three taking the top three spots on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles Chart.

At LA’s Ash Grove and McCabe’s Music Store she was taught her picking style from a young Ry Cooder who encouraged her to buy the Martin guitar she still plays today.

It all started because we wanted to hear Eli Høff live—one of Aotearoa’s most exciting producers of deep, intricate and compelling techno, built for altered states.

events.id: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
A story runs through it -What is the voice that mobilises readers?
Research explains why certain forms of storytelling are especially effective at leaving readers with the desire to act on ideas.
If you want readers to walk with you into issues that are important to you, this is your chance to find out how.
Marilyn will share some evidence regarding effective voice and content, along with suggestions to apply the research.
You’ll read a few samples and have time to jot down and discuss your own starting points.

events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver!
Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then how to form it up into a ring that fits you.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.
Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

events.name: Winter Natural Textured Rings - August
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
:-) Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools.
Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Everyone has a story worth telling — including you.
In this interactive workshop, you'll explore simple, engaging ways to begin writing your life story.
Whether you're looking to record memories for your family, reflect on your journey, or eventually publish a memoir, Gigi Fenster will help you take the first step.
No writing experience required — just bring your memories and a willingness to explore.
Limited places – secure your spot now!

events.venue: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
A panel discussing indie, professional and self publishing.
Traditionally published YA fantasy author Katharine J. Adams, self-published romance writer Leanna Morgan and indie-author Anne Ingram chat about their experiences in the publishing industry.
Learn why they chose to pursue their specific publishing pathway and the pros and cons of each.
Participants will gain insight to the different modes of the publishing industry – traditional, independent, self-publishing – and have the opportunity to ask questions.
Our thanks to NZSA Wellington Branch for sponsoring this event.

events.id: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā-Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā
events.venue: Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Ruri' is one word for a 'short love ditty, poem or jingle'.
Rongoā is most often understood as being healing or medicinal.
Ruri Rongoā is about being together, about connection with each other and in this case, having some fun with language itself.
At this session we'll spend time reading poems by awesome queer rangatahi, then we will write a couple ourselves -- one on our own, and one together as a group.
Suitable for ages 15-20.

Created by tamariki and rangatahi from the Ōtaki Kids Market and overseen by local chef Lucinda Caldwell from Seriously Pickled Catering Co., it features a selection of teas, a refreshing mocktail on arrival, and a tempting mix of sweet and savoury delights - from finger sandwiches to delicious slices and cupcakes.

events.id: Where Does The Chocolate Come From? A World Building Workshop-19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Where Does The Chocolate Come From? A World Building Workshop
events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Bring your coloured pencils and join Katharine J. Adams to learn how world building can shape your story and vice versa.
Draw your own fantasy map, and create a believable fantasy world that readers (or TTRPGers) will fall into and never want to come out.
Topics include terrain, magic systems, civilisations and how they shape your magical new world.
Includes a Q&A with Katharine, author of the bestselling, NZCYA shortlisted, Witches of Halstett series.
Limited spaces - book now to secure your spot

events.id: Voices of Kāpiti: Rangatahi spoken word showcase-59 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Voices of Kāpiti: Rangatahi spoken word showcase
events.venue: 59 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.description:
Come and experience the power, passion, and creativity of Kāpiti’s young voices in this vibrant spoken word performance.
Guided by acclaimed poet Te Kahu Rolleston, rangatahi aged 13–18 take the stage to share original pieces that reflect their stories, identities, and connections to place.
Fresh from a dynamic workshop, these young performers bring raw energy and heartfelt truth to the mic in an unforgettable celebration of youth voice and local storytelling.
Don’t miss this inspiring showcase of the next generation of Kāpiti storytellers!
Limited places – book your seat now!

events.description:

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Seasoned Wellington writer Jenny Pattrick’s latest novel, Sea Change, digs into the developing tensions within a small Kāpiti Coast community forced to negotiate a managed retreat after a rupture in the Alpine fault generates a devastating tsunami.
Tensions of a different kind propel debut author Jennifer Trevelyan’s A Beautiful Family.
This suspenseful coming-of-age novel turns around a summer holiday on the coast and the search for a missing girl.
Two authors at different stages of their careers discuss their work with Kate Duignan.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.name: Next-Level BA: half-day workshop (Wellington)
events.venue: 2/318 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This is a course focused on a mindset shift (with the tools to back it up) to enable you to add more value as a BA.
As projects become more ambiguous and agile, the expectations on a BA are changing in a way gives us the opportunity to make a bigger impact - if we have the skills to take advantage... Workshop scope: 0.
If you are used to working ‘in’ projects but are ready to take more control in shaping them, then this is the perfect course for you!
What will you get out of the course?
You will walk out of this workshop with some genuinely practical skills to help put you in a leadership position within a project environment (shaping the approach, and course that the project takes).

events.id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton-15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210-Humanitix
events.name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton
events.venue: 15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
"With restoration of the land, comes restoration of the people."
Goodlife Collective is proud to bring this screening of Dynamic Planet by Kiwi Producer Martha Jeffries to Tara-a-Whānganui Wellington, with the support of Commonsense Organics & Greater Wellington Regional Council.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to hear from the filmmaker herself, recently returned to New Zealand after 13 years in New York.
They reveal how science, nature, and traditional knowledge can prepare us for the future.
Comprised of four episodes: Earth, Water, Fire & Ice - we will be screening the 'Earth' episode.

events.name: Permacomputing 101
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This light-hearted talk will introduce some old, some new and some eccentric ideas for keeping computers and their software running for as long as we can.
Come and learn some tricks to fight planned obsolescence and also build new things that might survive the onslaught of corporate capture.
We’ll be streaming this talk from aboard a little sailboat adrift somewhere in the Pacific!
No prior knowledge of computing required.
About the host, Devine Lu Linvega Vagabond, lifelong student and co-founder of Hundred Rabbits.

events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Tue 12 August and runs for 8 weeks until Tue 30 September, 5.30-8pm.
Beginners will focus on cabochon stone set ring.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Advanced: Chain Making and other projects.

events.name: Marketing Foundations
events.venue: McGlashen Avenue Nelson, Tasman Region
events.description:
This course will empower small to medium sized businesses to expedite their marketing initiatives.
By establishing a solid foundation, businesses can ensure they allocate their time and resources effectively, especially when lacking the capital for a comprehensive one-on-one marketing strategy with a professional strategist.
The course will contribute significantly to the long-term success of participation businesses by laying the groundwork for informed and strategic marketing decisions.
Learning Outcomes Participants will gain the ability to; Identify gaps in their current marketing strategies and business plans.
Tailor their communications to resonate with their ideal customers.

events.id: Long Lunch with Matua Jones- Taranaki Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Long Lunch with Matua Jones
events.venue: Taranaki Street Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Shane Jones, Minister for Oceans and Fisheries, Minister for Regional Development, Minister for Resources, Associate Minister of Finance and Associate Minister for Energy is not your average politician, nor is this your average political lunch.
The eponymous Matua has lent his name to this lunch in a testament to the tenor of this event.
Expect an honest and insightful discussion on politics and the New Zealand economy – in an articulate and open forum.
This is one of our year’s most anticipated events - brought to you by the ‘Power of 3’: The historic partnership between the Wellington Chamber of Commerce, Te Awe Māori Business Network and The Wellington Pasifika Business Network, as well as principal sponsor Pacific Business Trust.
Tables: If you would like to be manually invoiced or you would like to book a table of 8 people, please contact Wellington Chamber of Commerce to book this directly: events@wecc.org.nz Member tables: $760 + GST Non-member tables: $960 + GST Agenda: From 12.00pm - Guest arrival & networking 12.15pm - Guests seated for lunch 12.25pm - Mains served 12.55pm - Hon.

events.id: Bridget Douglas and Michael Tsalka - Flute and Piano-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bridget Douglas and Michael Tsalka - Flute and Piano
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
The program opens with J.S.
Internationally renowned visiting pianist, Michael Tsalka, showcases two solo works for piano: Pauline Viardot-Garcia’s charming Sérénade and Gavotte, followed by the World Premiere of Two Poems, One Meditation by British composer Prof. Nicholas Smith.
He has recorded 40 critically acclaimed CDs, with repertoire from the Baroque period to the Contemporary Era (including many world premiere recordings) for NAXOS, Grand Piano, Paladino, Brilliant Classics, IMI, Sheva Collection, Wirripang, Tempus Clasico, and Ljud & Bild.
Circa 85 contemporary compositions (which he premiered) were dedicated to him by composers from all over the world.
Bridget is Section Principal Flute of the NZSO and an Artist Teacher in Flute at the New Zealand School of Music - Te Kōkī.

events.id: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Wed 13 August and runs until Wed 17 September, 5.30pm-8pm.
Level one: Students learn carving in hard wax, texture forming in soft wax, and how to clean up and finish your metal pieces.
Course costs include basic materials for the process, but do not include the eventual metal costs for the pieces you choose to cast.
As this is subject to each students' choice of size and type of metal, we leave this up to you to decide.
Learn to set stones into your designs and either: Cast them IN the metal (exciting and organic) or, more advanced students can learn to set them in a fabrication class.

events.id: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Professor Richard Beasley CNZM FRSNZ, the 2024 Rutherford Medal winner, will highlight ten influential research programmes that have challenged long-held clinical assumptions, advanced medical knowledge, and directly influenced patient care: Should fever be treated?
What was the cause of the epidemic of asthma deaths in New Zealand?
Biography Professor Richard Beasley, renown academic, physician, and researcher, is the founder and director of the Medical Research Institute of New Zealand (MRINZ).
Richard was Deputy Chair of the Health Research Council of New Zealand from 2010 to 2016 and has had a longstanding medical advisory role with the Asthma and Respiratory Foundation of New Zealand, chairing the adolescent and adult asthma guidelines group.
Richard was appointed a Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to medical research in 2008; elected a Fellow of the Royal Society Te Apārangi of New Zealand in 2015; awarded the Sir Charles Hercus Medal in 2016 in recognition of the impact of his research, the Beaven Medal in 2019 in recognition of his translational research, and was awarded the Rutherford Medal by the Royal Society Te Apārangi in 2024 for revolutionising the treatment of asthma worldwide.

events.id: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington
events.description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
The Wednesday performance will be followed by a Q&A session.
Born in Wellington, she lived permanently in England and Europe from 1908 until her untimely death from tuberculosis in 1923.
She became a central figure in literary modernism alongside contemporaries such as Virginia Woolf and DH Lawrence.

You’ll get to meet the finalists and applaud the winners at an exuberant awards ceremony in the characterful Pipitea Marae on Wednesday 13 August.
Their achievements will be acknowledged on the night by publishers, politicians, booksellers, librarians, media and supporters of the children’s literature community.
Members of the public are welcome to purchase tickets too.
This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so book your place today and enjoy this wonderful celebration of Aotearoa’s very best children’s literature.

events.description:
Get ready to say “I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do, I Do!” to the smash-hit jukebox musical based on the songs of Swedish super-group ABBA.
This sunny, funny, international phenomenon unfolds on a Greek island paradise when, on the eve of her wedding, a young woman’s quest to discover the identity of her father brings three men from her mother's past back to the island they last visited 20 years ago.
With music & lyrics by Benny Andersson & Björn Ulvaeus, Mamma Mia!
is written by Catherine Johnson and features non-stop laughs and explosive dance numbers, set to ABBA's hit songs including Super Trouper, Dancing Queen, Knowing Me, Knowing You; Take a Chance on Me, Thank You for the Music, Money, Money, Money; The Winner Takes It All and SOS.
became the 8th longest running show in Broadway history where it played a record-breaking run for 14 years.

events.venue: Main Street Ōtaki, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.venue: , Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
What's in-store: Join us and other Wellington business leaders for a practical and empowering evening of insights and networking.
You'll discover: · How the programme makes financial literacy accessible through educational content and free mentoring · What sets Know Your Numbers apart — and why it works · How your business or organisation can get involved and benefit right away Meet your speaker Tamara Somers - General Manager, Sustainability & Impact, Xero Tamara is a seasoned ESG leader and changemaker.
Part of the Xero team since 2021, Tamara is responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting on Xero’s sustainability performance through business-wide initiatives.
Tamara's impressive career has been built on ensuring success for businesses, with her experience including ESG leadership roles at Telstra and Glencore, strategy consulting with Bain and service as a Diplomat for Australia.
Fast-track for your business’ finances Whether you're trying to make sense of your finances or get ready to take your next big step, this is your chance to get the clarity and support you need.

events.id: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
What to Expect Guided Elebreath®️ session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence) Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.
Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply: Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially) History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues.
You may choose to simply receive the energetic field and breathe gently if needed.
We suggest: Drinking plenty of water Taking time to rest and reflect Journaling or voice noting any insights that arise Spending time in nature or grounding practices (e.g., bare feet on grass, epsom salt baths) Avoiding overstimulation or intense conversations immediately after Free Integration Resource Kit As part of your experience, you’ll receive access to a free post-session integration kit via my private Circle community, which includes: A grounding breathwork audio to support your nervous system reset A curated Spotify playlist for emotional flow Reflective journaling prompts to deepen embodiment and remembrance Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!
As the founder of Elebreath®️, her work bridges somatic breathwork, nervous system regulation, and energetic mastery with intuitive embodiment and deep manifestation practices.

events.id: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Transforming Self-Sabotage: FasterEFT Techniques for Effective Change
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Through a blend of insight, guided reflection, and FasterEFT-based techniques, you'll begin to free yourself from the internal patterns that keep you stuck.
You’ll walk away with a personalised action plan to support real, lasting change.
This workshop will help you:•⁠ ⁠Identify your personal self-sabotage patterns and triggers•⁠ ⁠Understand how these patterns affect different areas of your life•⁠ ⁠Recognize the emotional and physiological roots of self-sabotage•⁠ ⁠Learn practical FasterEFT techniques to change sabotaging behaviours•⁠ ⁠Understand the connection between trauma responses and self-sabotaging behaviours Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!
Meet Your Host: Krishnaloka Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology.
As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms.

events.id: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Leading by Learning is both a theory and practice of effective, ethical educational leadership that enables you to make significant progress on the problems of practice that prevent you or your colleagues from achieving improvement goals.
Leading by Learning is the evolution of the seminal work of Argyris and Schön, whose 30-year research programme described why leaders struggled to create the organisational and interpersonal cultures that build trust, honesty, and collective commitment to solve important problems.
The course fee is $866 + GST per person.
This includes: the cost of the two-day workshop a one-year subscription to the Leading by Learning online hub (a value of $200!)
We are encouraging teams to attend these workshops.

events.id: It's the Little Websites that Count-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: It's the Little Websites that Count
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
For most current technology, it is assumed that the user is always online and has access to unlimited data.
But this assumption is only valid for regions with the infrastructure to support the internet.
As more vital communications and services transition into websites, how do we make sure that these services are still usable in areas with only low bandwidth internet or during natural disasters?
In this event we will start a discussion about developing smaller websites for accessibility in Aotearoa.
About the host Vic Roberts is a computer vision scientist who works with machine learning in medical imaging.

events.id: Ration the Queen's Veges-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ration the Queen's Veges
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No.
Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien.
ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood.
While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

events.id: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder

events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.description:
Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington Friday, August 15 @ San Fran- Wellington With special guests Valley Kids Loop, The Edge and Mai FM are stoked to present Corrella and their upcoming Skeletons Winter Tour!
After a massive summer of festivals and touring alongside L.A.B across Aotearoa and Australia, Corrella are hitting the road this August for their biggest headline tour yet — bringing their new album Skeletons to the stage for the very first time.
The album follows their breakout debut Road From 26, which featured the sleeper hit Blue Eyed Māori—a track that now holds the record for the most weeks ever spent at Number One on the NZ Singles Chart.
This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date.
See Corrella live as they hit the road in August for their Skeletons Winter Tour taking on Auckland's Tuning Fork, Hamilton’s Factory, Wellington’s San Fran, Christchurch’s The Church & Dunedin’s Erricks, presented by Loop.

events.description:

Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation.

events.id: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
Paperghost The musical project of the prolific artist & game developer, Zach Webber.
Inspired by cryptids, horror films & gadgets for sonic manipulation, he mixes live instruments, synths and samples to create intricate music that aims to immerse the listener in a curious space between the sublime, serene and dreadful.
--- Rara Sekar (multi-instrumental) & Waterfalls (flute) Rara Sekar (aka Hara) is an Indonesian singer-songwriter who blends inspiration from folk with Indonesian traditional music, cinematic pop, ambient and field recording.
Amber Johnson (aka Waterfalls) [Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Kahu ki Whangaroa] is a classically trained flautist with a thirst for pushing the flute's capabilities and the sonic possibilities inherent in expanded techniques and experimental music.
Her exploratory sensibilities meld with her love of harmony, modal music and the beauty of lush sounds.

events.name: Padi Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible.
That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive.
Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).
This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.

An introduction to Adobe's page layout and design programme.
Good computer skills essential.
This introduction to Adobe's program will cover: setting preferences; understanding the frame-based approach through exploration of frame creation, properties and use; placing and editing text (with styles); placing graphics; defining and applying colour and print considerations.
By the end of the workshop, you'll have been introduced to InDesign.
You'll be shown the program and the main features of its desktop, and then be taken through how to create and work with the main publishing items (text and graphics) in order to create your own publication.

You can type a letter to your nanna, some delicate poetry or a 1000 page novel - just whatever you fancy.
Typewriting novices and experts - everyone's welcome.

events.id: Discover Te Muna – Explore the Wines-Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Discover Te Muna – Explore the Wines
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.description:
Born from passionate vignerons who embrace the challenge of extreme weather conditions, Te Muna Valley’s unique microclimate and soil structure produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.
Join us for an interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers.
You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard, not normally open to the public.
Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines.
The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting and snack on some local products while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.

events.id: Thyme Well Spent: a Herb-infused Afternoon-Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Thyme Well Spent: a Herb-infused Afternoon
events.venue: Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton
events.description:
Nestle into the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse for a mindful winter afternoon of watercolour nature journaling.
Surrounded by the subtle beauty of the winter garden, you’ll be guided to sketch and paint seasonal herbs like rosemary, thyme, and sage, learning techniques to capture detail and texture in your journal.
This peaceful session is perfect for slowing down and reconnecting with nature through art.
Sip on bubbles and savour warm rosemary focaccia with herb-infused oil as you work.
No experience required — just bring a curious eye and a love of seasonal beauty.

events.id: Oyster Bar and Off-the-map Wine Tasting-Karahui Wine Bar & Eatery, 1 Memorial Square, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Oyster Bar and Off-the-map Wine Tasting
events.venue: Karahui Wine Bar & Eatery, 1 Memorial Square, Martinborough
events.description:
This event pairs the indulgence of freshly shucked oysters with a rare opportunity to taste boutique wines from the most exciting low-intervention winemakers: Equilibrium, Huntress, and Halite.
Hosted at Karahui Wine Bar & Restaurant the experience features a pop-up oyster bar serving fresh oysters to order, complemented by a rotating pour of wines direct from the winemakers’ cellars—including special releases and limited bottlings.
Guests will meet the makers, sip on unique expressions of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, skin-contact whites and so on and learn how these wines interact with the delicate brine, minerality, and texture of oysters.
Walk-in tasting

events.name: Kapiti Irish Society Winter Dinner
events.venue: Marine Parade Paraparaumu Beach, Wellington Region
events.description:
Kapiti Irish Society Winter Dinner Come join us for a cozy evening at the Kapiti Boating Club for our annual Winter Dinner!
Indulge in traditional Irish cuisine, enjoy live music, and mingle with fellow Irish enthusiasts.
This event is a great opportunity to celebrate the season and connect with the local Irish community.
Don't miss out on this chance to experience a taste of Ireland right here in Kapiti!
Doors open at 5.30pmDinner at 6.30pmLive Music at 7pm Irish buffet Braised beef brisket with jus’ Irish whiskey Glazed champagne ham with mustard condiments Traditional Irish colcannon ( creamy potato mash with kale) And more.... events.venue: Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough
events.description:
Take the edge off winter with a unique evening of warmth and indulgence at Colombo Martinborough, in collaboration with The Sauna Project Wairarapa.
Join us for a relaxing escape under the stars.
Your ticket includes a 30-minute express sauna session with an optional cold plunge to revitalise, followed by a delicious takeaway pizza and a mug of mulled wine to enjoy while you wait.

events.id: On a Good Day - EP Launch - Hihi & The Stitchbirds-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: On a Good Day - EP Launch - Hihi & The Stitchbirds
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.description:
7:00pm - Doors 7:30pm - The Bidibids 8:30pm - Hihi & The Stitchbirds After a whirlwind 18 months as a five-piece folk band, Hihi & The Stitchbirds are delighted to release their debut EP with five original songs that will make you feel soothed and seen.
They will be joined on stage by their friends the Bidibids.
Pairing rich vocal harmonies with vibrant original music inspired by the folk and Americana playbooks, this band brings something for everyone.
Hihi & The Stitchbirds are: Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals Tess Luff - guitar, banjo uke and vocals Matt Hutton - bass uke and vocals Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals About the Bidibids: With lush harmonies, intricate arrangements, and beguiling melodies, the Bidibids explore what it means to play folk music in New Zealand.
The Bidibids are Sarah August on banjo and guitar, Simon Carryer on cello-banjo, and Brendan Schenk on mandolin and guitar.

events.id: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Welcome To Our Lounge Tour - Featuring songs from Linda Ronstadt & Carole King Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 16 August 2025 Sue Dyson, a gifted vocalist known for her warm and captivating stage presence, backed by talented pianist Mitch Dean to offer an extraordinary musical experience that celebrates the enduring legacies of Linda Ronstadt and Carole King.
Set in Hilltop's laid-back intimate atmosphere, their performances promise an engaging experience where the audience will tap their feet to the classics that have defined generations.
Additionally, Sue has lent her voice as a backup vocalist at the prestigious New Zealand Music Awards and has enjoyed significant success with her original country music in Australia.
Notably, he played keys and guitar in the acclaimed Wellington Fleetwood Mac Experience, contributing to their successful tour.
Mitch’s deep understanding of music, combined with his skillful instrumentation, enriches the duo's sound and enhances the overall performance.

events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Orangefarm and Warm Regards Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs.
Warm Regards is a band that epitomizes style, comfort, economy, and power — a sleek sedan equally at home on the racetrack or with the family bundled safely in the back.
Blending indie rock, pop, folk, and jazz-country flair, their infectious sound and high-energy performances have earned them a dedicated local following.
With frontman Tom Watson (Cassette, Terror of the Deep, HLAH) leading the charge, Warm Regards deliver introspective lyrics, tight grooves, and lush harmonies that promise an unforgettable live experience.
Orangefarm brings a distinct mix of shimmering guitars, melodic hooks, and lyrical wit that’s become their signature sound.

events.id: Fareham Journey Free Information Tour-Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Fareham Journey Free Information Tour
events.venue: Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston
events.description:
Fareham Journey is building a sustainable cohousing community in Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston and they are looking for people who share their kaupapa to create this with us.
The Fareham property has extensive grounds which include a historic homestead, farmland, established organic gardens and an orchard, old school buildings, a swimming pool, and an arts community on site.
We run these free information and tour events on the third Sunday of every month, from noon until 2pm at Fareham, 80 Underhill Road, Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston.
Learn about the Fareham Journey and our vision to create a sustainable and supportive community and how you can get involved.
We invite you to bring a plate of vegetarian food to join us for a shared meal in the historic homestead, Fareham House, followed by the tour.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC - Tonga Māori Constituency-In-studio- The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC - Tonga Māori Constituency-In-studio
events.venue: The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.description:
Roussel "The Spider’s Feast: Symphonic Fragments" Saint-Saëns "Carnival of the Animals" It’s a bug’s life in Roussel’s "The Spider’s Feast", a suite depicting the insects found in a garden.
This special performance moves from the garden to the Aotearoa New Zealand native bush with Giant Wetas, Huhu Grubs and all the fluttering life found in the forest.
One thing is always clear, the spider is always looking for lunch.
This work is guaranteed to make the kids laugh, smile, and squirm!
We also welcome Oscar-winning songwriter and funny man Bret McKenzie.

events.venue: Colombo Martinborough, 107 Todds Road, Martinborough
events.description:

In this intimate Paint & Sip workshop, you’ll be guided to create a beautiful watercolour painting of grape clusters, inspired by the fruit that defines this iconic wine region.
No experience is needed—just a willingness to relax, reconnect, and let your creativity unfold.

events.id: Ghost Trio (piano trio)-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ghost Trio (piano trio)
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and Gabriela Glapska (piano).
The programme is titled “Between Tides” based upon the concept of a journey through time and cultural landscapes, showcasing the evolution of chamber music from the late 18th century (Beethoven) to the 20th century (Shostakovich), and finally to the contemporary era (Takemitsu, Downie).
There is a world premiere of a work by New Zealand’s own Glen Downie, written especially for the Ghost Trio.
Ludwig van Beethoven, Piano Trio in D major Op 70 No.
2 in E minor Op 67

The Vocal Blokes are back — refreshed, re-energised, and ready to raise the roof with a mix of toe-tapping favourites and brand-new tunes.

events.venue: Space Place at Carter Observatory, 40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Beyond the horizon lies the secret to a new beginning.
17th August Part of Sci-Fi Sundays 2025.
In a future where the polar ice-caps have melted and Earth is almost entirely submerged, a mutated mariner fights starvation and outlaw “smokers,” and reluctantly helps a woman and a young girl try to find dry land.
$25 per person.
Tickets include complimentary popcorn and an optional live star talk after the screening.

events.id: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour-Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour
events.venue: Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
"Presented by Strung Out Touring Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour After opening for Kasey Chambers around Australia, award-winning songwriter Jenny Mitchell returns home for a national tour celebrating her acclaimed album Forest House.
Now based in Melbourne, the AU Review describes Jenny’s music as a “sublime slice of folk” and her new highly anticipated album, Forest House, is capturing fans across the motu and the globe.
- Old St Paul's - Sunday 18 August - Doors open at 7pm - Support from Katie Thompson NZ Best Country Artist Winner and 2 x Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny Mitchell, is a storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand with impactful songs full of grace and grit.
Her last album ‘Tug of War’ included the pivotal release of the 2022 APRA NZ Best Country Song ‘Trouble Finds a Girl’ and was described by Rolling Stone as an album, “worthy of every award it will inevitably collect.” No stranger to the road, Jenny was recently awarded a scholarship to perform at Nashville’s iconic AmericanaFest and has toured Australia and New Zealand extensively over the last decade - supporting artists including Fanny Lumsden (AU), Tami Neilson (NZ) and Nadia Reid (NZ) along the way.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Join editor and poet Nick Ascroft as he introduces a crackling selection of New Zealand poets from his edition of the annual online anthology Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems.
James Brown, Robin Peace, Simon Sweetman, Stacey Teague, Philomena Johnson, Kiri Piahana-Wong, Zephyr Zhang, and others will read their work, and poems by the late Fleur Adcock, Vincent O’Sullivan, and Paula Harris will also be celebrated in this warm-up to Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions-1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions
events.venue: 1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand
events.description:
Doctors For Nutrition and MTM Charity invite you to an evening of inspiration, education, and connection at our next ‘Dine with a Doc’ dinner.
Join us for a presentation on ‘The Power of Plant-Based Nutrition and Lifestyle Interventions for Preventing Chronic Disease’—an event designed to empower everyone from healthcare professionals to health-conscious community members.
You will also be the first to hear about the new MTM charity, and about their mission.
Through easy-to-understand explanations of key concepts - such as endothelial dysfunction, intramyocellular lipid accumulation, and calorie density - you’ll discover how WFPB eating can dramatically improve health outcomes and transform lives.
After the presentation, join us for a panel discussion and a Q&A session with Dr Haitjema and Dr Luke Wilson.
