events.name: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025
events.venue: . Wellington, Wellington .
events.description:
Empower your school with structured literacy approaches – PLD for years 0-8 Join us for professional learning and development (PLD) designed to help schools implement evidence-based structured literacy approaches across Years 0-8.
Our expert facilitators work alongside teachers and school leaders to strengthen literacy instruction, ensuring every learner develops the skills to succeed.
✔ Implement a clear, systematic, and cumulative approach to literacy.
✔ Strengthen decoding, fluency, comprehension, and writing instruction.
✔ Support learners who need additional scaffolding and intervention.

events.id: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington-. Wellington, Wellington Region .-Event Brite
events.name: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington
events.venue: . Wellington, Wellington Region .
events.description:
Tāwhirihia is a fully funded, year-long professional learning opportunity for the one teacher in each school, with the staffing entitlement to lead targeted and tailored support.
If that’s you, this course will deepen your expertise in structured literacy approaches and equip you to make a measurable difference for students in Years 0–2 who need it most.
You’ll build, apply, and refine your practice through three integrated strands: Te Hau Mātea – Five full-day, in-person workshops to build deep knowledge and practical tools Day One and Two: 19th and 20th August Day Three and Four: 4th and 5th November Day Five: 25th November Te Hau Piritahi – Five short online sessions to reinforce strategies and share insights with peers Te Hau Arotahi – Small-group coaching to apply learning in context, adapt instruction, and stay on track.
A 60 min online introductory session will be held preceding the first day - date TBC Each strand builds on the last — helping you turn evidence into action, and action into impact.
NB; The MOE fund one teacher per school.

events.id: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report-Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report
events.venue: Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
The NZCBIA Building Construction Report, commissioned by the New Zealand Chinese Building Industry Association (NZCBIA) and led by renowned economist Shamubeel Eaqub, is fast becoming a respected voice in New Zealand’s property and construction sectors.
This year’s edition provides practical insights into key industry issues, with a particular focus on people, including workforce trends, productivity, training and upskilling, diversity, and the growing impact of AI.
Backed by data and real-world case studies, the report sheds light on the challenges and opportunities shaping the future of the sector.
The Parliamentary Launch brings together industry leaders, government representatives, and key stakeholders to mark the release of this influential report and to drive conversations that support the sustainable development of New Zealand’s building and construction industry.

events.id: Kiwibank business insights: The commercial advantage of sustainability-level 8/20 Customhouse Quay, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kiwibank business insights: The commercial advantage of sustainability
events.venue: level 8/20 Customhouse Quay, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The good news?
Embracing sustainability can help you do just that.
Co-hosted by Kiwibank, WellingtonNZ and the Sustainable Business Network (SBN).
What to expect: Insights from the Sustainable Business Network on the real, bottom-line benefits of sustainability A keynote from Mike Casey, Founder of Rewiring Aotearoa, on how electrification is helping Kiwi businesses cut costs and future-proof against rising energy prices Real-world examples and tips you can apply now The opportunity to connect with other business leaders tackling the same challenges About the hosts At Kiwibank, we're proud to be B-Corp certified, joining a global movement of businesses committed to balancing purpose and profit.
WellingtonNZ is committed to building a sustainable region - supporting initiatives that protect the wellbeing of the people and environment, both now and in the future.

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!

events.name: Organizational Skills 1 Day Training
events.venue: PH: +1 469 666 9332 Washington, DC 20036 United States
events.description:
Through Organizational Skills you will encounter improved productivity, better management, and an overall increase in professional growth.
Everyday people waste numerous amounts of time looking for items.
So stop looking for those important items, and start knowing where they are by getting organized.
Target Audience: Anybody who is interested in learning Organizational Skills.
Learning Objectives:● By the end of this course you will be able to: Remove the Clutter Prioritize Scheduling Your Time To Do Lists Paper and Paperless Storage Organization Your Work Area Tools to Fight Procrastination Organizing your Inbox Avoid the Causes of Disorganization Discipline is the Key to Stay Organized Prerequisites: None Course Materials: Attendees will receive a course manual with presentation slides and reference materials.

Under the guidance of an expert coach, this one-day Professional Development training course provides you with the knowledge and skills to leverage a reflecting, thinking, and planning process, and create a personal development plan to accelerate your individual career goals.

events.name: The Energy Equation - Reclaim your Productivity. Redefine your Success.
events.venue: Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
But what they actually have… is an energy problem.
And it’s costing more than you think—in clarity, performance, and profitability.
Energy management is the new competitive advantage.
In this hands-on session, you’ll: ✅ Crack the Code on Productivity Fatigue Understand why managing your energy—not just your time—will shift how you work (and feel) every day.
This session will fill fast – secure your spot and experience the productivity breakthrough you didn’t know you needed.

events.id: Tūhura: Te Māramatanga ki ngā Tukanga – Insights to Actions-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tūhura: Te Māramatanga ki ngā Tukanga – Insights to Actions
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The conversations that will shape the future of vocational education are happening here.
Will you be in the room?
Tūhura: Te Māramatanga ki ngā Tukanga – Insights to Actions is your chance to be part of a gathering that will define the future of vocational education in Aotearoa’s construction and infrastructure sectors.
ConCOVE has been at the forefront of research and innovation in vocational education, and this flagship event is our opportunity to share the latest research and the steps you can take to create change where it matters the most: in workplaces, training providers, and policy development.
As ConCOVE’s funding nears its conclusion, this is your last chance to be part of embedding the findings that will shape the industry for years to come.

events.id: Getting Paid Faster- Hardy Street Nelson, Nelson-Event Brite
events.name: Getting Paid Faster
events.venue: Hardy Street Nelson, Nelson
events.description:
A strong credit management process ensures your business has a framework in place to manage your debtors and respond faster to late-paying customers.
Our complimentary seminar, Getting Paid Faster, will show you practical and proven strategies to ensure you’re getting paid as fast as possible.
Join us on Wednesday 20th August at 9:30am for this 60-minute seminar, where you’ll: · Understand the impact slow payers have on your business · Learn what best practice debtor management looks like · Identify key strategies to reduce the time it takes your customers to pay you · Understand how to approach overdue debtors with empathy · Learn how you can improve your Cash Conversion Cycle We’ll provide all attendees with a Credit Management Guide and Credit Management Script Templates to support you to get paid.

events.id: Wellington City Chorus – Women’s Barbershop-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington City Chorus – Women’s Barbershop
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington City Chorus is a group of dedicated and talented women (and one man) who perform one of the few musical art forms that originate in the United States - Barbershop Harmony.
Wellington City Chorus is a chapter of Sweet Adelines International.
This non-profit organisation is dedicated to teaching, learning and singing four-part harmony, barbershop style, through performances and teaching, perpetuating and creating a love for this style of A Cappella singing in our community.
Wellington City Chorus is fortunate to have David Brooks as our Director – skilled in and enjoys the craft of barbershop and willingly passes on his knowledge.
As previous national champions Wellington City Chorus has represented New Zealand on the international stage in Las Vegas, Hawaii, Denver, Baltimore and St Louis.

events.id: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!-, NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
events.venue: , NTT Tower Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
3 Gals, One Beehive – live!
Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
Because this is a reminder that politics isn't just about policies and power plays - it's about stories, people and the laughs that come with it.
Whether you're a political junkie, or just dipping your toes into current affairs, Three Gals One Beehive invites you to pull up a chair, pour a glass of wine and join the conversation that's as enlightening as it is entertaining: Whether it's recounting drama that’s reminiscent of a House of Cards episode or assessing the strategic manoeuvres that would be at home in The Queen’s Gambit, their podcast promises to make even the driest political topics engaging.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.

events.venue: 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up.
The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
The August event will have see us ask the mayoral candidates for Wellington about their plans for the economy and how they see tech & science playing into them.
The event will be MCed by Wellington science journalist Peter Griffin, and, at this point, we have three candidates confirmed: Andrew Little Karl Tiefenbacher Ray Chung We won't know until 1st August who the final candidates are.

events.id: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.” Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.
Christopher Finlayson served as an MP for 12 years, including as Attorney-General and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations from 2008 to 2017.
He co-founded Kāhui Legal in 2003.

We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.

events.description:
Step away from the noise and into a space of calm and creativity.
In this gentle, guided workshop, we’ll explore simple yet powerful art-based mindfulness practices designed to help you slow down, reconnect with yourself, and find presence through making.
Using a mix of mark-making, colour exploration, and intuitive drawing, you’ll be encouraged to let go of outcomes and tune into the process—no pressure, no perfection, just peaceful creativity.

events.id: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender-Hamilton-Humanitix
events.name: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender
events.venue: Hamilton
events.description:
You don’t feel you’ve the right to pursue your dreams You don’t have the confidence to speak up and share ideas You’d love to dress differently but you’re scared what people will say.
You’re doing what’s expected of you, but it feels like you’re leading someone else’s life.
This workshop is for you If lack of confidence is holding you back If you’re struggling with leadership If you’ve been told you’re too much What we'll cover in the workshop Build a foundation that’ll empower you to take risks, overcome fear and self-doubt, and do the things you’ve always wanted to do.
A fun day of laughter and connection for anyone who wants to explore how they can take up more space in the world.
Meet your irreverent badass hosts Miraka (Shelly) Davies Described as the lovechild of Brené Brown and P!nk, aged 37, Shelly walked away from her family’s five-generation commitment to conservative Christianity and started the exploratory period of her life, also known as “fucking shit up.” A people pleaser in recovery, she infiltrates organisations on the pretext of giving writing training and subverts teams to question the rules, while using her hard-won lessons in badassery to inspire you to know yourself, love yourself, find power, and have joy.

Export 101 Series: Exporting to Germany and the EU A series of in-person workshops designed to equip you with the essential tools and knowledge for successful market entry and growth in Germany.
Whether you're new to exporting or looking to enhance your presence, this series is tailored to meet your needs.
This workshop series offers insider knowledge and practical advice from experienced exporters, helping you navigate the German market with confidence.
You'll learn how to leverage opportunities from the EU-NZ Free Trade Agreement, connect with peers and trade professionals, and walk away with actionable steps and tools to support your export journey.

events.id: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact Whether you are just starting out or already running a business, having an online and social media presence is essential.
While most of us know in theory that we need a marketing plan, a social media strategy, a consistent post schedule, and engaging reels for TikTok, the reality is that every business is unique, and your approach should reflect that.
With attention spans shorter than ever, your audience will move on within seconds if they are not engaged—they see images first and then only start reading the text.
In this course, we will explore different types of content suitable for your specific needs and audiences, how to create it or where to source it, how to develop the right visual strategy for your online presence, what tools to use, and how to implement it immediately.
By the end of the course, you will have an outstanding online presence.

Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s.
As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy.
His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.

events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.

events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
The English Locust is the folk/blues solo project of Wellington musician Jim Bailey.
The English Locust describes his sound as " Bob Dylan if he was goth", fusing the melancholy poeticism of groups like the Smiths and Joy Division with the musical stylings of folk and Delta Blues.
With his solo project The English Locust, he was a regional finalist in this years Battle of the bands, being the only soloist to make it that far in this years competition.
The group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mabudungun word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money.

events.id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures.
Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.
If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.
Techniques: - Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’ - Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal - Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal - Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces - Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces - Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options) Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

events.description:
What to Expect: Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

Once each season, our beautifully historic local church is transformed into an intimate haven, softly illuminated by the glow of 200 flickering candles and a gentle wash of laser light.
The result?
Guest Artists: The Kugels Take two former New Zealand Symphony Orchestra players, a virtuoso accordionist, and a renowned bass player — and you have The Kugels!
After nationwide tours with Arts on Tour NZ and Chamber Music New Zealand, and performances at major festivals, The Kugels continue to enchant and inspire wherever they play.
Whether you come for the spellbinding music, the magical candlelit setting, or the sense of connection and community, we promise an evening you’ll never forget — and one you’ll want to return to, season after season.

events.name: Girls Rock the Boys
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Girls Rock the Boys is bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage.
With Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, Jude Madill, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, and a stellar band backing them up, it's bound to be a night of high-energy performances.
This from our last gig... "Man did they ROCK!
4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking - check them out!"
An electrifying time warp!

events.description:
Get ready for a full-throttle night of chaos, distortion and anthems at WildKiwi Distillery – as Rail Records unleashes the first ever Upper Hutt TRIBUTE FEST, a high-voltage tribute to the gods of rock, metal, punk and industrial.
SLIPKNOT – by The Feeders THE PRODIGY – by The Firestarters NIRVANA – by The Neverminds GREEN DAY – by GreenGaze MARILYN MANSON – by The Antichrist Superstar PLUS a full-noise performance from heavyweights KAOSIS.
Supported by two of Aotearoa's top rock and metal DJs.
DJ ApenuT (Nu Metal) DJ Subpop (Grunge) Wall to wall riffs, raw energy, and nothing but attitude.
This is the hard rock night Upper Hutt’s been waiting for.

events.name: Creedence Clearwater Collective
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s.
Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs.
Many of them are still regularly played today.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band.

This high-energy night celebrates the biggest names in rock, metal, punk, and grunge with authentic performances that will transport you straight to the mosh pit.

events.id: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
Let the emotional knowledge you gain inform not only how you live your life but also how you feel about living it.
To do this you’ll identify your values hierarchy and learn about how this framework can inform how you live your life.
Once you can apply a spirit of consistency to your self-identified larger purpose, as well as your needs, then your life’s purpose, emotional needs and core values, will align.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Develop a Life Purpose Statement Perform an Emotional Needs Self-Assessment Elicit Your Core Values Align your goals with your life purpose, emotional needs and core values Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Bike Maintenance for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Bike Maintenance for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride.
Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course.
Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.
If you have the following, please bring them as well:  A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Name most parts of a bicycle correctly - Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle - Fix a flat tyre - Adjust your bike to fit your body - Oil and clean your chain - Identify and fix some common brake problems Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Cooking: Lentils – Types, Recipes and How to Cook Them-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Cooking: Lentils – Types, Recipes and How to Cook Them
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cooking: Lentils – Types, Recipes and How to Cook Them The lentil is perhaps the world’s most versatile and indestructible food.
It has significant health benefits from lowering cholesterol to supporting weight loss – and lentils are delicious when cooked well.
Enjoy this half-day course that will show you how to cook lentils properly and make the most of this nutritious staple ingredient.
Discover spices to complement and enhance lentils and create some mouth-watering dishes.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Creative Writing - From Idea to Page-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Creative Writing - From Idea to Page
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Creative Writing - From Idea to Page “Just write!” That’s the advice given to every newbie writer… but what happens when you struggle to get words on the page?
Please bring pen and paper.
Tea and coffee available for your breaks, please bring lunch and any snacks you may need.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Identify different brainstorming methods - Complete writing exercises to develop ideas - Describe your own writing process, and identify what works for you - Apply strategies to keep up writing momentum Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.name: Intro to Standup Comedy
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Intro to Standup Comedy In this class you will learn to: Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines Maximize laughter with great delivery Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.
By the end of the day, you’ll have heaps of your own ideas to explore further onstage, an understanding of tools used by professional comics, and the motivation and skills to brave your first or next open mic.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Knitting - Next Level-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Knitting - Next Level
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Knitting - Next Level Build on your learning from the Beginner’s Knitting class.
Learn how to read a knitting ball band and knitting pattern as well as gain a basic understanding of knitting abbreviations.
You will have practiced the wraps per inch method, practiced a couple of techniques as outlined by knitting abbreviations and understand tension as both a principle and practical guide in the craft of knitting.
By the end of the session you’ll be able to: Read a knitting ball band Know how to determine yarn weight using the wraps per inch method Read a basic knitting pattern Run through of basic knitting abbreviations (reference sheet provided) Understand tension: what is it, why you make tension swatches and how to alter tension as needed.
Explore the rules of substituting yarn Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Oil Painting Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Oil Painting Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Oil Painting Workshop In this course we will learn about painting with oils: one of the oldest and most interesting mediums, and one which has an undeserved reputation for being slow or intimidating!
In this workshop we will learn some quick methods for getting started in oils, using “alla prima” (wet on wet) methods to develop an understanding of the painting process.
In addition to learning about the practical side of the medium, there will also be opportunities to learn a bit about the extraordinary history of painting in oils.
Basic paint colours provided, you're welcome to bring along any that you may already have at home.
- Develop transparent glazes and washes over your painting.

events.id: Women's Health and Aging Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Women's Health and Aging Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $109 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women.
Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.
Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop, and bring a yoga mat or beach towel.

events.name: Zine Making - Introduction
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Zine Making - Introduction In this workshop you will be guided in making a classic cut and fold 8-page zine from a standard A4 sheet of paper - this is a clever design you can easily photocopy and reproduce later!
You will be introduced to a range of techniques and approaches such as cut and paste photos and text, collage and drawing on paper.
Paper, newspapers, magazines and basic drawing materials will be provided.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Cut and fold a classic 8-page zine format from a single sheet of paper Brainstorm content ideas for your personalised zine publications Arrange & compose text and images to fit a classic 8-page zine layout Combine cut & paste magazine content with hand drawn/ written content Create a draft zine of your personal interests Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: 456 Papanui Road, Christchurch
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track, explain The Grogans.
Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.
Usually, I’m in the same spot whilst mixing and can come and go from each track mentally, but this time the album was attached to us at the hip.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you have not planned for your retirement, then this course is you!
This course has been developed for people in their 50’s or 60’s that are looking at retirement and have no idea if they can financially survive it: what to do, what $’s they need, how or where they can generate additional income, or even where to go to get help.
At each step, key considerations and financial concepts will be defined, explained and discussed to help you understand the financial requirements of retirement.
A step by step planning process will be taught by working through a case study.

events.description:
Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer.
His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!
Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard (Buzz Mag).
Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.
Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence.

Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.

events.venue: Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
Are you a small business owner or manager wanting to improve your health and safety practices but not sure where to start?
Join Mallory from MD Safety Consulting Ltd, for a 90-minute interactive workshop designed specifically for small businesses like yours.
This workshop will cut through the confusion and provide practical, easy-to-implement strategies to help you meet legal requirements, keep your team safe, and build a strong safety culture.
What You’ll Learn: Health & Safety Compliance & Documentation – The essential documents you need (without unnecessary admin) Hazard & Risk Management – How to identify risks, assess them, and control them effectively Worker Engagement & Training – Simple ways to involve your team and ensure proper safety training Emergency Procedures – Creating an easy-to-follow emergency plan tailored to your business Incident Reporting & Investigation – How to report and learn from incidents to prevent future harm What You’ll Get: Practical tools & templates to apply immediately in your business Resource sheet linking to free NZ-based safety tools A chance to ask questions and get expert guidance Mallory understands the challenges of running a small business, and is passionate about helping business owners navigate health and safety in a way that is simple, effective, and realistic.
Whether you're starting from scratch or refining your current systems, this workshop will give you actionable steps to improve safety and compliance in your workplace.

Presented by: Jarrah Records John Butler returns to Wellington for an intimate show at Meow Nui and will be introducing his brand-new album, Prism live.
He will be accompanied by his 3-piece band, featuring Michael Barker, his original touring drummer; percussionist Michael Boase; and Ian Peres on keys and bass.
Prism is back to the full sound of John Butler, reclaiming his classic groove-laden force, brimming with fierce guitars, robust percussion and meteoric choruses.
The concert will feature new songs such as honky tonk country infused hit Trippin’ on You and the anthemic So Sorry, alongside classic JBT tunes, Zebra and Better Than as well as opus guitar instrumental, Ocean.

events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.
Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label.
His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.
In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.
Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

events.description:
Tāmaki Makaurau jangle heroes Cowboy Dan set out across Te Ika-a-Māui to celebrate the release of their debut full-length album, Dreams That Feel Like Falling.
Once aptly described as The Bats on the right amount of Red Bull, Cowboy Dan has been treating audiences across the motu to energetic, emotionally charged tunes since 2015.
Their live shows have consistently delivered good times to fans and new friends alike.
Off the back of two delightful EPs: We Will Hesitate, When We Eventually Wait (2017, Mixed by Jonathan Pearce); Sentimental Now That We're Leaving (2021, Mixed by Rohan Evans), the debut LP, Dreams That Feel Like Falling, showcases the bands expansive sonic pallet, with a mix of distortion, introspection, heart and bite.
Gather your pals and get on out for a night of alternative Aotearoa tunes.

Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm Wednesday 1st October 2025 Auckland based Albi and the Wolves set fire to stages and fill hearts with hope with their energetic and relatable alternative indie folk songs.
Proud albino frontman Albi (Chris Dent), Pascal Roggen and Michael Young have crafted a stage show brimming with energy yet with pauses for reflection.
The trio has a huge sound created simply by acoustic guitar, electric violin, double bass and three voices.
Since 2014, Albi & the Wolves have gone from strength to strength touring Australia, New Zealand and Rarotonga.
In 2018, they took home the Best Folk Artist Award at the NZVMAs.

events.venue: 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
A full 5Rhythms® weekend workshop in Paekākāriki, Wellington, New Zealand Join us for a deep dive into the skeletal landscape of the body—where form and movement provoke the memory of our animal, and mineral cells/selves.
In this weekend immersion, we’ll uncover the bones—exploring the structure, strength, support, and vitality that arise when we embody our bony architecture.
Through the 5Rhythms map, we’ll trace, align, and articulate the inner scaffolding that grounds our shapes, holds us upright, and upon which we can align our sense of self.
Her approach weaves embodied storytelling, deep listening, and transformative movement.
All willing movers are welcome.

DOORS 6:00 pm SHOW START 6:30 pm Tim Freedman is the lead singer, songwriter and pianist of legendary Australian folk rock group The Whitlams.
He will perform the best of his renowned nine album repertoire with pedal steel and electric guitarist Ollie Thorpe.
Since 2022 a reinvigorated Freedman has led The Whitlams in a resurgence, touring heavily and releasing two new albums “Sancho” (2022) and the Americana tinged “Kookaburra” (2024).
Between band tours he has started performing smaller country towns in duo mode, and this piano/pedal steel configuration has developed delicate atmospherics to suit the poignant narratives in Freedman’s songs.
In September The Whitlams will performs three shows with the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra.

events.id: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]-Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]
events.venue: Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
🔑 What You’ll Learn: What the new presumptive pet rights really mean for you How to strategically structure tenancy agreements with fair and enforceable pet clauses What reasonable grounds for refusing a pet look like in practice What you can legally ask about a pet during the application process How to vet pet-owning tenants and manage risk with confidence The roles of pet bonds, landlord insurance, and the Tenancy Tribunal How to balance your legal obligations with business expediency and long-term tenancy success 🧠 Workshop Includes: ✔ 3.5 hours of expert-led training ✔ Light morning tea ✔ Real-life scenarios and interactive activities ✔ Guest insights from insurance and proptech professionals ✔ Take-home clause templates, checklists, and Tribunal-prep tools 👩‍🏫 About Your Trainer Sarina Gibbon is the Director of Tenancy Advisory Ltd, a boutique consultancy specialising in residential tenancy strategy.
With a reputation as one of New Zealand’s most trusted tenancy experts, Sarina brings 15+ years of experience helping landlords, property managers, tenants, and community housing providers not just meet legal standards—but exceed them.
Attendees will also receive: ✅ A 3-month subscription waiver for agencies who sign up at the event ✅ Early access to Renti Academy and a one-month cancellation policy for trial sign-ups ✅ Bonus prize giveaways at each session Renti’s smart tenancy tools are the perfect complement to the new pet provisions—come see them in action!
While Initio won’t be attending in person, they’re contributing: 📘 A free downloadable eBook on pet-related damage and insurance coverage 🎥 A BONUS video Q&A session answering common insurance questions 📋 A co-branded post-event checklist on pet-proofing your rental and protecting your investment These resources will be made available exclusively to ticket holders—ensuring you walk away with long-term tools and practical know-how.
Sign up to our other sessions at Auckland, Christchurch or Dunedin.

Te Reo Māori - Introductory 2 By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: • Discuss our responsibilities as a bi-cultural nation under ‘Te Tiriti o Waitangi’ and identify underlying Māori values such as: whanaungatanga, pepehā and tikanga • Discuss the significance of whakapapa as a fundamental Māori world view and confidently describe your family and relationships through this lens • Form simple sentences to describe parts of your face and body • Discuss protocol on the marae • Recognise the importance and use of karakia and be able to recite one correctly • Recognise the cultural values inherent within different whakataukī (proverbs) and kīwaha (idioms) and be able to correctly recite one of each NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Piano Keyboards - All Levels If you’re a beginner, by the end of the course, you'll be able to: • Read simple single note melodies in both hands and play some chords • Understand the piano/keyboard layout, note names and interpret simple 3 note chords and chord symbols • Accompany a few right-hand melodies with 3-note left hand chords • Be able to read and clap some common rhythms accurately • Play a few simple hands-together pieces, working towards a performance If you already know some basics, you’ll be extended further to include: • Sight-reading beginner to intermediate fully notated music to perform a written piece with confidence.
• Developing further hand coordination and hand independency • Identifying a variety of written dynamics, articulations and signs • Identifying how key signatures and scales are constructed • Gaining further insight into interpreting chord symbols and using 4 note chords.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Songwriting: How to Write Your Own Songs The course is ideal for anyone who wants to write better songs - whether you’ve got a few songs under your belt or you’re a complete beginner.
You’ll see exactly how to turn theory into practice and write your best songs yet.
This course includes: -  Practical tips and techniques for songwriting -  Ideas for making your songs stronger, more expressive and more appealing to your audience -  How to overcome writer’s block, be an inspired and prolific songwriter who writes authentic songs -  An opportunity to share your songs with fellow students, bounce off ideas and learn from one another -  Learn how to structure a song effectively -  The pillars of songwriting and how to use them -  How to write better lyrics By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Discover the exact steps to successfully write your own original songs; expanding a song from a verse and chorus, to a complete song while keeping your listeners engaged using transitions and dynamic contrasts between sections -  Come up with ideas, write lyrics, melodies, chord progressions and instrumental grooves that have an emotional impact on you and your audience -  Identify the structure of a great song, including how to combine melody, chords, lyrics and rhythm that create magic for your listeners -  Possess the confidence and skills to find inspiration and get past common creative hurdles and blocks so you can develop an initial spark of creativity into a complete song -  Stay inspired and find your authentic voice as a songwriter.
r Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference
events.venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Ara Ake, in partnership with Community Energy Network and WISE Charitable Trust, is pleased to present the third annual Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference — formerly the Reducing Energy Hardship Conference.
About the conference This two-day event brings together around 200 attendees to explore the state of energy hardship in Aotearoa, highlight key innovations, and share insights from iwi, communities, and organisations leading change on the ground.
The conference provides a unique platform for thought leaders, practitioners, policy makers, and innovators to connect and collaborate on building a more equitable, affordable, and resilient energy system.
2025 Theme: Regional solutions for equitable energy New Zealand’s energy future must reflect the diversity of our people, places, and priorities.
As we face rising climate, infrastructure, and cost-of-living pressures, regional approaches are becoming key to improving energy resilience—our ability to respond to and recover from disruptions—and affordability, particularly in rural and remote communities.

You'll Learn: Managing Email Effectively - Strategies for taming your inbox Documenting what you do - How and why you do it into an Operations Manual that captures policies, procedures and processes Maintaining documentation in a way that works for you and your business Introduction to tools that will help you streamline your day and keep you and your tasks on track This workshop is a MUST for any self-employed individual, administrator or manager of a small team!

Pumpkinhead celebrate the 30th anniversary of their critically acclaimed album Sloth this year, performing three exclusive never to be repeated reunion shows.
Sloth entered the New Zealand Album Charts on 30 April 1995, peaked at number 28 and stayed in the charts for 4 weeks.
Their single “I Like” made it to number 16 in the Official Top 40 singles chart 10 March 1995.
“Now “Sloth”, Pumpkinhead’s debut album, compresses the quintet’s live energy into a head spinning whirlpool of fierce punky rock, powerful pop, and tempo-hopping Faith No More style metal.
Not for the innocent!” – 4.5 stars – NZ HERALD 1995 “Sloth is the sound of a band that’s already found its feet, the sound of a band that’s played 500 gigs before recording their debut album.

events.id: Kora-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Kora
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
KORA are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever.
With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own.
Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience.

events.name: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
To celebrate the anniversary of the British band Queen’s famous song, a tribute act is touring and stopping in Wellington.
Think big sound, big screens, crazy lighting, and outlandish costumes.
Dominic Warren will take the lead performing lead vocals, guitar and piano.
All songs are in Freddie’s original key.
Get ready to mosh to ‘We Will Rock You,’ ‘We Are the Champions,’ ‘Radio Ga Ga,’ ‘I Want to Break Free,’ ‘Somebody to Love,’ ‘Don’t Stop Me Now,’ ‘Another One Bites the Dust,’ ‘A Kind of Magic,’ and of course, ‘Bohemian Rhapsody.’

events.description:
Since debuting as a stand-up comic in 2009, British funnyman Rob Beckett has built an impressive career.
From podcasts and radio to hosting, television, and voiceovers, Rob is a versatile comedian.
New Zealand audiences might recognise him as one of the winners of the popular show ‘Taskmaster’, or the long-running ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’.
He has many other UK television shows to his name including ‘Rob & Romesh Vs.’ and ‘Celebs Go Dating’.
Now a father of two, he has focused his lens on the ups and downs of parenting and produces a smash-hit podcast ‘Parenting Hell’.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Find out what the size of your match means and the tools available to help you work out possible family relationships.
Also covered during this course are other websites you can upload your results to, how to manage other family member's DNA test results and other tools available when you get a bit more advanced - and just in case you need help in the future, we'll look at some of the places you could get this from.
Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network.
Bring a USB stick and your Ancestry.com login details.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Understand the information provided by Ancestry.com about your DNA matches -  Use the Grouping, ThruLines and Common Ancestors tools on Ancestry.com -  Use the Shared CentiMorgan tool on DNAPainter.com -  Understand where to find other tools -  Understand the options for using other DNA websites -  Understand where to get further help Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

Through alchemical technology, sound vibrations, and breathwork, we inspire a divine collaboration within the cells of your mind, body, and soul.
Our last event was an incredible success, and due to the deep transformations that unfolded, we are bringing it back in October 2025 for another powerful gathering.
We are honored to have an incredible lineup of contributors, each weaving their threads of wisdom and magic to co-create a weekend of deep activation and restorative integration.
Event Details 📅 Two-Day Immersion – Your ticket includes both days 🕚 Saturday, Oct 11 | 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM 🕙 Sunday, Oct 12 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM Ticket Tiers 🎟 First Round – $222 (15 passes only) - SECURE ASAP 🎟 Second Round – $333 🎟 Final Round – $444 What to Bring ✅ Yoga Mat ✅ Cushion/Blanket ✅ Journal ✅ Water Bottle ✅ BYO Cup for Cacao ✅ BYO Plates, Bowls & Cutlery for shared meals ✅ A plate of nourishing kai to share at the end of Saturday as we ground together Please Note This event is designed for deep inner work and integration, making it unsuitable for young children and no dogs are permitted in the hall.

events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

events.id: the Jesus Lizard NZ Tour: San Fran, Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: the Jesus Lizard NZ Tour: San Fran, Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs.
However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.” Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.
Yet, when  that band is the Jesus Lizard, everything in your pathetic cultural dystopia suddenly falls  away and the air smells like Heaven… Their seventh studio album, Rack, produced by Paul Allen, and slated for release on September 13 via Ipecac Recordings, features 11  tracks of brisk guitar rock you haven’t heard since… the last time the Jesus Lizard took  over a stage in your town.
The Jesus Lizard — vocalist David Yow, guitarist Duane Denison, bassist David Wm.
The Jesus Lizard.

events.id: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI.
Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit.
Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ.
He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus.

events.id: Ryan Adams-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ryan Adams
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of his breakthrough debut album ‘Heartbreaker,’ multi-Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter Ryan Adams is set to embark on his ‘Heartbreaker’ tour.
He will bring the album and more to audiences across Australia and New Zealand in October 2025.
Known for his genre-defying sound, Ryan will deliver an intimate, acoustic set that showcases his expansive catalogue.
Since its release in 2000, ‘Heartbreaker’ has become a cornerstone of Ryan Adams’ career, featuring tracks such as Oh My Sweet Carolina, Come Pick Me Up, and To Be Young (Is to Be Sad, Is to Be High).
This tour offers a chance to experience these songs live.

events.description:
Harakeke (Flax Weaving) Workshop Gain an introduction to the Māori art of flax weaving in an intensive one-day workshop, suitable for beginners and those with some experience.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to: •  Identify commonly-used types of harakeke •  Describe how to harvest and prepare harakeke for use •  Describe the tikanga (the protocol) surrounding the use of harakeke and weaving •  Demonstrate some basic weaving techniques •  Construct and complete a small project Materials provided but please bring a 'bread and butter' knife and 8 spring-loaded clothes pegs.
Tea and coffee provided but please bring your lunch.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Posture Perfection is Possible!
Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to: • Identify and reduce muscle tension • Move with more lightness and freedom • Improve your posture • Describe some basic anatomy • Have tools to use at home and at work Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing.

The Saints 73-78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).
They have been a part of my life since stumbling upon them in the early 80s.
I am stoked, stunned, and humbled that I get to joi in on this Rock ‘n’ Roll Reality Camp with Ed, Ivor, Peter and Mick!”– Mark Arm The tour also comes off the back of arecent 4 LP box set of 1977’s ground breaking debut (I’m) Stranded which features the original album remastered forvinyl for the first time in over 40 years, the previously unreleased 1976 mix of the album, a 5-song live performance from April 1977 at Sydney’s Paddington Town Hall, a full live show from the London’s Hope and Anchor in November 1977 plus all recordings from the 1977 Top 40 charting This Perfect Day and 1-2-3-4 ep sessions.

events.description:
Professional Trouser Sewing Techniques Learn the correct process to successfully make a pair of trousers, this course will teach you professional industry standard techniques that are adaptable, achievable and versatile.
Note: You'll be working on pre-cut, supplied sampling pieces - you do not make a pair of trousers in this course.
Please bring half a metre of reversible cotton fabric, your sewing kit (including 1 or 2 spools of quality thread, fabric scissors, snips (optional), pins, tape measure, chalk (or fabric marking pencil), hand-sewing needles), a Bernina bobbin (if using one of he school's sewing machines), pencil and paper, water bottle and lunch.
By the end of the course you'll be more confident with: Assessing different types of inseam pockets and choosing one to sample Making a fly front zipper Applying a waistband Sewing up the inner and outer leg seams and the crotch seams Evaluating hemming methods Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Cowboy Junkies - Celebrating 40 Years
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington
events.description:
Cowboy Junkies will be performing a career-spanning show from The Trinity Session to their recent album, Such Ferocious Beauty!
Tour Dates Tuesday 4th November – Town Hall, Auckland Thursday 6th November – Opera House, Wellington Friday 7th November – Regent Theatre, Palmerston North Sunday 9th November – Isaac Theatre, Christchurch Tuesday 11th November – Fortitude Music Hall, Brisbane Thursday 13th November – Civic Theatre, Newcastle Friday 14th November – State Theatre, Sydney Tuesday 18th November – Astor Theatre, Perth Thursday 20th November – Woodville Town Hall, Adelaide Sunday 23rd November – Palais Theatre, Melbourne About Cowboy Junkies Sometimes revolutions begin quietly.
In 1988, Cowboy Junkies proved that there was an audience waiting for something quiet, beautiful and reflective.
The Trinity Session was like a whisper that cut through the noise — and it was compelling.
It stood out in the midst of the flash and bombast that came to define the late 80’s.

events.description:
Presented by: Eccles Entertainment Breakout Aotearoa five-piece NO CIGAR have announced a three-date tour across New Zealand this November, in celebration of their highly anticipated third studio album Under the Surface, due for release July 30th.
Since forming in 2019, NO CIGAR have built a fiercely loyal fanbase across Aotearoa and beyond, carving out a unique niche that blends elements of indie, surf, and alternative rock.
Their upcoming album is crafted for the stage — shaped by the band’s dynamic chemistry and a deep connection with their audience.
NO CIGAR’s 2023 sophomore album The Great Escape spent more than 74 consecutive weeks on the NZ Top 20 Albums Chart and featured the breakout hit “Concubine,” voted the 10th best rock song of 2024 by listeners of The Rock FM.
Their past tours across NZ, Australia and the UK have consistently sold out, driven by a word-of-mouth buzz and a reputation for electric, unforgettable performances.

events.id: Cheesemaking - Farmhouse Cheddar Cheese Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Cheesemaking - Farmhouse Cheddar Cheese Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cheesemaking - Farmhouse Cheddar Cheese Workshop During this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of farmhouse style cheddar.
All ingredients, recipes and a full set of course notes are provided.
You’ll also receive comprehensive instruction on how to wax (if you choose to) and then mature your cheese over the next five weeks.
Alexis will also demonstrate how to make halloumi cheese which will then be grilled for you to enjoy!
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to: • Describe the basics of sanitisation and hygiene • Recognise the difference between raw and pasteurised milk and know where to source them • Make a round of cheddar cheese using a cheese press • Describe how to wax and mature the cheese • Describe how to make halloumi, following a demonstration Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
It’s a celebration of comedy, songs, and multifarious skills.
Bill Bailey Vaudevillian is a wild ride through the lost art of vaudeville.
Before streaming, before TV, before cinema, even before radio, there was vaudeville.
A theatrical tradition invented mid-19th century in France, vaudeville was a type of variety show.
It might have included popular and classical musicians, singers, dancers, magicians, ventriloquists, strongmen, impersonators, or clowns.

Bruno Groening (1906-1959) brought a simple message: there is a higher power that is the basis of all living things and it can heal.
He showed how this energy can be absorbed freely into the body, and through his teaching many people were cured back then as today, even from diseases that are considered incurable.

Our Information Lecture is open to all interested people.

events.id: Rob Thomas - The All Night Days Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Rob Thomas - The All Night Days Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington
events.description:
The All Night Days Tour will travel to theatres this November, taking in Auckland’s Kiri Te Kanawa Theatre on Tuesday 11th, Te Pae Christchurch Convention Centre on Thursday 13th, before finishing up at Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre on Saturday 15th.
After such amazing Matchbox shows in 2024, it’s so great to revisit the solo catalogue, and I can't wait to come back and share these songs with my Kiwi fans.
It’s going to be a very special run of shows, said Thomas.
Managing Director of TEG Van Egmond, Christo Van Egmond said “We’re absolutely thrilled to be bringing Rob Thomas back to New Zealand for this incredible run of shows.
To see an artist of his calibre in intimate theatre settings is a rare treat, and it’s going to be a truly memorable experience for fans around the country.” The upcoming tour promises to deliver the captivating live performances that Thomas is known for, and audiences can expect a night filled with timeless hits including “Lonely No More,” “This Is How A Heart Breaks,” “Her Diamonds,” “Street Corner Symphony,” the Grammy-winning Santana collaboration “Smooth,” as well as Matchbox Twenty favourites like “3AM” and “Unwell.” Rob will also perform his powerful new single “Hard To Be Happy,” giving fans a taste of All Night Days.

events.id: Sharon Van Etten And The Attachment Theory | Wellington-The Opera House, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Sharon Van Etten And The Attachment Theory | Wellington
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington
events.description:
* with special guest SHANNON LAY (USA) Tickets from Banished Music “...right up there with Van Etten’s most majestic tracks ever” - www.consequence.net “A new dawn for the music of the night.” – The Times “...you could be forgiven for thinking that this latest incarnation of Sharon Van Etten has seen her reborn.” – The Herald (Glasgow) Following the gigantic recent announcement that Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory are headlining The Others Way Festival this November, Banished Music and Strange News are delighted to reveal the band are also set to play their very own shows in Wellington and Christchurch, with very special international guest Shannon Lay joining in support at both shows.
That her band’s debut album is her own seventh album is a testament to Van Etten’s willingness to reinvent and follow her instincts for change, even after this long on the job.
Now sixteen years into an extraordinary career, it seems our heroine has fully accepted her mantle as one of the world’s great rock stars, fronting her gothic-tinged new outfit to widespread awe and acclaim, Devra Hoff on bass guitar and backing vocals, Teeny Lieberson on keys, guitar, and backing vocals, and Jorge Balbi on drums.
The Guardian were quick to assure us that “This is no mere indie-folk musician,” and Pitchfork said her most recent studio album “presents a quiet, lovely, undramatic rendering of the dramatic”.
We truly could not be more excited to be welcoming Queen Shazza back to Aotearoa for these shows, and with the addition of both her band The Attachment Theory and Shannon Lay’s opening spot, you should be dang well excited too!

events.id: Pixies-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Pixies
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
They influenced the sound of the 90s.
American alt-rock band Pixies formed in 1986.
Still popular more than 35 years later, they are heading to the St James Theatre for a two-night residency.
On the first night, they’ll play two 90s classic albums in their entirety – ‘Bossanova’ and ‘Trompe Le Monde’.
For the second night, they’ll play from their new album ‘The Night The Zombies Came’ plus other songs from their catalogue.

events.id: Pixies - 2025 New Zealand Tour-St James Theatre, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Pixies - 2025 New Zealand Tour
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington
events.description:
PIXIES have announced a 2025 New Zealand tour which will see the alt-rock legends perform two consecutive nights in both Auckland and Wellington.
On the first night, they’ll play classic albums, 1990’s Bossanova and 1991 follow up Trompe Le Monde in their entirety, followed by a cross catalogue set and songs from their new album The Night The Zombies Came on the second night.
Pixies have just released their tenth studio album The Night the Zombies Came to critical acclaim, with MOJO saying, This most thrillingly deathly of bands remains alive and DIY stating, Pixies remain one of the most consistent, influential bands on the planet.
Pixies wowed UK fans in August with their mainstage performance at London’s All Points East, described as “raucous” by Rolling Stone UK after their sold-out Glasgow Academy show was tipped as “a full-on head rush of classics by the Scottish Sun and as relevant in 2024 as they were over 35 years ago by Glasgow World.
35 years since their groundbreaking Platinum-certified album Doolittle catapulted the band into the UK Top Ten, and 20 years since their celebrated reformation at Coachella, Pixies are deep into their second act, and in the midst of a creative purple patch.

Whether you’ve followed his journey from afar or are discovering his music for the first time, this tour is set to be a celebration of song and spirit from one of Australia’s most compelling live performers.
I have three now and each year I fly between them playing festivals and seeking the far corners of world and all the beautiful places I can play music I was lucky enough to become good friends with Billy Bragg from England early on and he taught me a lot about longevity and living as an artist for the long haul.
‘Window to the Sky’ was the most played song on triple J at that time and it went on to be 42 in the Hottest 100 and is Platinum in Australia, Gold in Canada and Germany .and has over 50 million streams!
I toured it around the world as an independent self managed artist.and sold over 12 thousand tickets and played 149 concerts Now I'm back in Australia in my camper van writing this from a small town on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia.
I’m have a new album coming out October 11th and am.

events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Course: SPOPEU Duration: 4 Days Audience: End Users Microsoft Course: 55215 Overview This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises.
Your goal is to learn how to make SharePoint relevant to your team by using a sites functionality to help you share information and collaborate with your colleagues.
During the class you will also learn best practices and ‘what not to do’ as you watch live, interactive demonstrations and put theory into practice with hands on exercises.
Module List Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint Module 2: Finding Content Module 3: Working with Lists Module 4: Working with Libraries Module 5: Working with Publishing Features Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business Module 7: Site Owner Responsibilities Module 8: Creating and Managing Sites Module 9: Site Customisation Module 10: Permissions and Security Module 11: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries Module 12: Advanced Document Management Module 13: Power Platform Integration Module 14: Creating & Managing Content Types Click here for the full 'SharePoint Online for Power Users' course outline Click here for the full 'SharePoint 2019 for Power Users' course outline

events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Presented by: Banished Music "[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" — The Guardian This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
“There’s a questing robustness to these songs, a sense of somebody finally having the perspective to seek out answers to long-hanging questions.” ★★★★ — MOJO Enter Now feels different.
It is an album, she says, of departure and questioning, that has reminded her how songwriting can be “the most useful thing to do with pain and joy and thoughts and feelings and anger.” That through music we can find great change.
“I’m so much better off now that it exists,” she says.
“Now feels like a new time.”

events.description:
Valhalla Touring are proud to announce direct from Canada, one of the worlds most brutal Death Metal bands, the mighty CRYPTOPSY, headlining 2 shows to close out the year of 2025, on their ALL SO VILE tour!!!
More than 30 years into their storied career, Montreal Death Metal innovators Cryptopsy return with their ninth studio album, An Insatiable Violence, set for release on June 20, 2025 on Season of Mist.
Revered in extreme Metal circles for such groundbreaking classics as 1994’s Blasphemy Made Flesh and the 1996 magnum opus None So Vile, Cryptopsy find yet another gear on An Insatiable Violence, which further solidifies the band’s place in the upper echelon of Death Metal.
Coming out of the pandemic, the band dedicated themselves to staying on top of their game more than ever before, with the intention of consistently putting out a new record every two years.
That started with 2023’s acclaimed As Gomorrah Burns, which WON them a CANADIAN GRAMMY, and continues 21 months later with An Insatiable Violence.

events.id: Amble The Reverie Tour-San Fran, Wellington-San Fran
events.name: Amble The Reverie Tour
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Critically acclaimed Irish folk outfit Amble will return to Australia in February 2026 for a string of headline shows, celebrating the release of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Reverie captures the essence of Amble’s signature style — raw authenticity, heartfelt storytelling, and melodic intimacy, wrapped in warm acoustic instrumentation and ethereal vocal harmonies.
Recorded live across studios in Ireland and Los Angeles, the album reflects the spirit and simplicity of the band’s early days.

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk.
Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies.
The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days.

events.id: CubaDupa--Wellington NZ
events.name: CubaDupa
events.description:
One weekend every March, CubaDupa takes over some of Wellington’s central city streets for an epic party.
The free annual festival brings a carnival vibe to the end of the summer.
It offers live music, street theatre, dance, parades, and other cultural experiences.
CubaDupa is New Zealand’s largest outdoor arts and music festival.
It takes place over two days on Cuba Street and the surrounding roads, right in the heart of Wellington.
